Company Name:Smoke Guard California, Inc.


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:Smoke Guard California, Inc.

Trade:CANCELLED- Elevator Smoke Doors

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Subcontractors shall work at jobsite Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Additional costs for overtime or premium time with prior approval from the Project Manager.
002: 
This is a “Prevailing Wage” Project. Subcontractor has fully explored the requirements of this project and has included all labor costs associated with those findings. Labor Costs shall include but are not limited to, hourly rates, vacation rates, apprentice training programs, penalties assessed for improper record keeping, etc.
003: 
Ownership is seeking LEED Silver Certification on this project.  All accociated LEED costs are included in this subcontract agreement.  
004: 
Subcontractor shall funish and install (18) Smoke Guard Model M200 smoke containment systems.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor to deliver, Unload, Hoist, and Install Smoke Guard doors.
006: 
Subcontractor shall provide Coordination with all affected trades.
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install Auxiliary Rails with special #430 Ferretic Stainless Steel #4 Brushed Finish that holds magnets and does not need painting.
008: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install Rails that run from finish floor to Smoke Guard Sheet Metal Housing to be concealed by Ceiling Soffit by others.
009: 
Subcontractor is responsible to verify all field dimensions.
010: 
Subcontractor shall furnish detailed shop drawing, operating systems, finishes, warranty information and all other Submittals per plans and specifications.
011: 
Installation shall be in accordance with manufacture's instructions and recommendations and all requirements of listing agency and code authorities having jurisdiction.
012: 
Design to reflect physical dimensions of plans.


013: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all fees for delivery, unloading, spreading, taxes, insurance and installation as required.
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all support information to all affected trades at each floor as required.
015: 
If elevator hoist way door frame is constructed of non-ferrous material (stainless steel, brass, bronze or aluminum), or do not have a flat 2-inch wide face, or are recessed into or flush with the hoist way wall, provide auxiliary rails and rail brackets to retain smoke-containment curtain edges against face of door frame.
016: 
System shall be connected to normally open auxiliary contact circuit of smoke detector or central fire alarm system by others.
017: 
Release mechanism shall be capable of deployment of the smoke containment system in less than 10 seconds and comply with UL Standard No. 508.
018: 
Assembly shall include all alarm contacts, interfaces, controls, accessories and features, including side mounting of rewind motor if necessary due to restricted overhead clearance.
019: 
Operate doors at least three times in the presence of the Owners representative.
020: 
Demonstrate the proper operation of the doors in the emergency mode.
021: 
Activate emergency deployment of smoke containing curtain by setting off the smoke alarm or fire alarm as applicable.
022: 
If operations are not proper, adjust doors and replace components as necessary to achieve proper function and retest doors and controls.
023: 
Subcontractor shall provide training to the owner's representative on the proper operation, resetting and on going maintenance of these systems.

Alternates


Exclusions

001: 
Electrical and Low Voltage Wiring

002: 
Permits, Fees
003: 
Smoke Detectors
004: 
Level 1 Elevator Openings
005: 
Overtime
006: 
Soffit and Ceiling Work
007: 
Bond
008: 
Backing or Blocking


Schedule of Values

________________________________





Company Name:Royal Cabinets


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Royal Cabinets

Trade:Cabinets

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
OPERATIONS
002: 
In general, cabinetry fabrication, pre-finishing, assembly, and installation shall confirm to or supersede Southern California Association of Cabinet Manufacturers written guidelines.  Cabinetry shall be installed true, square, plumb, level, and firmly anchored for a long life under hard use.  Any manufacturer red materials (ie. hinges, screws, guides, plywood, particle board, hardboard, melamine, etc. shall be handled and installed pursuant to manufacturer's requirements and instructions for that specific use and confirm to Project Specification requirements.
003: 
Before field measuring and prior to manufacturing, Subcontractor shall verify with the Project Superintendent all dimensions for (i) appliance openings, (ii) range vents, (iii) plumbing lavatory and sink sizes, (iv)convenience outlets, (v) dishwasher service, (vi) soffits, (vii) HVAC and electrical lines, (viii) and any other possible trade needing coordination.  Subcontractor shall also verify if additional backing is needed to insure proper installation.  All costs for sink and appliance cutouts are included and considered part of this Contract.
004: 
Subcontractor to coordinate with Contractor in writing at or before Rough Framing all required backing locations, which will be installed by others.
005: 
 Subcontractor is responsible at the time of measurements to check floors, walls, ceilings and soffits to which cabinets attach and/or abut to, for being level, straight and true.  Subcontractor to verify at this time that proper backing is provided for cabinet installation. Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Superintendent of all concerns and/or deficiencies in writing prior to installation.  
006: 
DELIVERY
007: 
Subcontractor shall deliver directly to and install in each unit, all required wall cabinets, base cabinets, bathroom cabinets, face frames, and linens, if applicable.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for delivery F.O.B. the jobsite and storage of cabinets and materials, until said items are installed.  In the process of distributing materials, Subcontractor shall not store or stack his materials in any manner that may hinder or increase the work of any other Subcontractor.
008: 
FABRICATION
009: 
All wall, base, pantries, and bath cabinets shall be fabricated utilizing solid material for all door frames and filler.  All stained grade cabinets - (doors, drawers and side panels) - shall be of the same material.  There will be no mixed species of materials.  
010: 
All cabinet work shall be thoroughly sanded, securely screwed and glued.  Face frames, doors and drawer faces shall be free of stains.  Sharp edges shall be eased and all surfaces shall be pre-finished prior to job delivery and installation.  All nails and screws shall be firmly set and countersunk.
011: 
All cabinets shall be pre-finished prior to delivery to jobsite.
012: 
Toe kicks for cabinets shall compliment the cabinet finish.  No particleboard toe kicks will be allowed.  Toe kicks shall fit tight to all walls.
013: 
All shelving, solid and adjustable, shall be 5/8" installed tight to walls.  Gaps greater than 1/32" will not be accepted.  Shelving and cabinets shall be free of defects, voids, chips and imperfections, tightly butted together with applied molding at the leading edge or a factory pressure filled edge as approved by Contractor. 
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all necessary trim and scribe molding.
015: 
All drawer sides and bottoms to consist of solid stock material.
016: 
All bottoms of upper cabinets, which are exposed (above eye level) such as cabinet uppers and refrigerator uppers shall be filled, no gaps or openings.  
017: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install door silencers, ie. Silicone pads, for all cabinet doors and drawers.
018: 
Corbels/bands shall be supplied and installed, as needed, for applicable countertop installation.  Corbels/bands shall be and screwed through the backs and down through plywood rough top.  
019: 
Subcontractor shall supply matching base shoe for all kitchen and bathroom cabinets, to be installed by others.
020: 
INSTALLATION
021: 
Subcontractor's work shall be installed pursuant to the best trade practices, scribed to the wall or neatly fitted with approved scribe molding.  Cabinets shall be square, level, and plumb within ¼" in 10 feet in any direction.
022: 
Fasteners must not be over used or long enough to damage utilities hidden within walls.
023: 
Subcontractor shall install kitchen cabinets so that there is a minimum 18" between the bottom of the cabinet uppers and the finished countertop height. 
024: 
Subcontractor shall install a hanger/stiff back or cleat under counter top where return cabinets meet in corners, to support the countertop weight. 
025: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
026: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
027: 
Case Type:  Full Overlay
028: 
Wood Species:  Maple
029: 
Finish: TBD
030: 
Type of Frame:  Face Frame
031: 
Door Style:  Coped Shaker
032: 
Drawer Fronts: Flat Panel
033: 
Door & Drawer Pulls: 6" Bar Pull Satin Nickel
034: 
Drawer Bottom Material Thickness: 5/8"
035: 
Crown Molding:  5/8" Scribe
036: 
Light Rail: N/A
037: 
Base Shoe:  Provide ¾" base shoe at vinyl / hard-surface locations; 
038: 
color pre-finished to match cabinets.  (Case to case bases). 
039: 
Bread Boards:  Two (2) Each
040: 
Kitchen:  29" High wall cabinets; 35" finished height base w/ 3" toe kick + Rough top (Granite top by others).
041: 
Master Bath:   32-1/2" finished height base with 4" kick +  Rough top (Granite top by others).  21" standard depth.
042: 
Secondary Baths:  32-1/2" finished high base cabinets with 4" kick + Rough top (Granite top by others). 21" standard depth.
043: 
Unit Laundry: N/A
044: 
Hinges: Self-closing, concealed  
045: 
Cabinet Interiors:  Maple Laminate (low-pressure laminate)
046: 
Drawer Box & Guides:  Maple (Euro Glides) 
047: 
Shelving:  Adjustable Upper and Pantries, Fixed at Lower.
048: 
Finished Backs:  Upper and pantry cabinets only.
049: 
PLAN CHANGES AND CLARIFICATIONS
050: 
22. The specifications outlined in the "Project Specification Book" and or "Project Manual," shall take precedence over specifications outlined in this scope of work unless otherwise stated below.  The Project Specification Book shall be considered a part of the Contract Agreement and it is Subcontractor's responsibility to clarify discrepancies with Contractor's Purchasing Department prior to award of contract.  Subcontractor is to review said document for other trades product specification which may affect his work.
051: 
a.                   Appliances to be GE Appliances, www.geappliances.com 
052: 
b.                  Unit Appliances to be:
053: 
                                            I.            Refrigerator:  GTH18KB
054: 
                                          II.            Range: JBS13
055: 
                                        III.            Range Hood: JN327
056: 
                                        IV.            Dishwasher GSD3300
057: 
SCHEDULING
058: 
The starting date, schedule per day, and completion date shall be furnished by the Project Superintendent.  Installation rate is a minimum of eight (8) units per day.  Faster production may be required, if dictated by the construction schedule and/or Contractor.  Subcontractor shall staff the project with the required manpower to ensure a timely completion, pursuant to the construction schedule.
059: 
ADA REQUIREMENTS
060: 
All cabinets are handicap accessible or upgradeable.  It is the responsibility of this Subcontractor to ensure the compliance with all ADA requirements, even if it is not expressed stated in the Plans and Project Specifications. 
061: 
Subcontractor shall supply and install two (2) each 15-inch breadboards pursuant to all ADA specification and requirements.  All cutting boards shall have a hardwood face front and back and shall color match the cabinets. All cutting boards shall be installed prior to tenant move-in by Subcontractor, do not deliver cutting boards with cabinets. 
062: 
26. ADA Requirements this subcontractor may be required to follow, are as follows (Subcontractor's responsibility to verify and implement):
063: 
a. Vanities and lavatories shall be installed with the centerline of the fixture a minimum of 18 inches (457 mm) horizontally from an adjoining wall or fixture. The top of the fixture rim shall be a maximum of 34 inches (864 mm) above the finished floor. Cabinets under lavatories are acceptable provided the bathroom has space to allow a parallel approach by a person in a wheelchair and the lavatory cabinets are designed with adaptable knee space.  Knee space shall be provided as follows:
064: 
 i.      The knee space shall be at least 30 inches (762 mm) wide and 8 inches deep (203 mm).
065: 
ii.      The knee space shall be at least 29 inches (737 mm) high at the front face and reducing to not less than 27 inches (686 mm) at a point 8 inches (203 mm) back from the front edge.
066: 
iii.      The knee space required in this section shall be provided by one of the following:
067: 
iv.      The space beneath the lavatory is left clear and unobstructed.
068: 
b. Any cabinet beneath the lavatory is removable without the use of specialized knowledge or specialized tools or,
069: 
c. Doors to the cabinet beneath the lavatory are removable or operable to provide the required unobstructed knee space.
070: 
d. Toe space shall be provided as follows:
071: 
i.      Shall be at least 30 inches (762 mm) wide and centered on the lavatory.
072: 
ii.      Shall be at least 17 inches (432 mm) deep, measured from the front edge.
073: 
iii.      Shall be at least 8 inches (229 mm) high from the floor.  In each such case, the finish floor beneath the lavatory shall be extended to the back of the wall.
074: 
PROTECTION OF WORK
075: 
Cabinets delivered during rainy weather shall be free of water spots.  No knots, pitch pockets or other defects shall be allowed.
076: 
PICK UP & CUSTOMER SERVICE
077: 
Subcontractor shall correct any discrepancies in his work and leave the insides of cabinets and surrounding areas broom clean and acceptable by Project Superintendent.  
078: 
Before acceptance of cabinets by Contractor and prior to Owner walk through, Subcontractor shall have all pick-up work complete; such as alignment and adjustment of tall doors and drawers, replacement of any damaged or defective rollers and guides, replacement of any warped or bowed doors, repair and touch-up of any chips, scratches, dents etc., and a complete installation of any missing materials, molding, trim scribe moldings, hardware, hinges, etc.
079: 
Subcontractor understands and agrees to perform customer service work for one (1) year from Notice of Completion relating to materials and/or workmanship.

Exclusions

Company Name:Commercial Wood Products


ProjectName: 2700 S Figueroa ProjectID = 39

Subcontractor:Commercial Wood Products

Trade:Cabinets

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
SPECIFIC - CABINETS
002: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
003: 
In general, cabinetry fabrication, pre-finishing, assembly, and installation shall confirm to or supersede Southern California Association of Cabinet Manufacturers written guidelines.  Cabinetry shall be installed true, square, plumb, level, and firmly anchored for a long life under hard use.  Any manufacturer red materials (ie. hinges, screws, guides, plywood, particle board, hardboard, melamine, etc. shall be handled and installed pursuant to manufacturer's requirements and instructions for that specific use and confirm to Project Specification requirements.
004: 
Before field measuring and prior to manufacturing, Subcontractor shall verify with the Project Superintendent all dimensions for (i) appliance openings, (ii) range vents, (iii) plumbing lavatory and sink sizes, (iv)convenience outlets, (v) dishwasher service, (vi) soffits, (vii) HVAC and electrical lines, (viii) and any other possible trade needing coordination.  Subcontractor shall also verify if additional backing is needed to insure proper installation.  All costs for sink and appliance cutouts are included and considered part of this Contract.
005: 
Subcontractor to coordinate with Contractor in writing at or before Rough Framing all required backing locations, which will be installed by others.
006: 
Subcontractor is responsible at the time of measurements to check floors, walls, ceilings and soffits to which cabinets attach and/or abut to, for level and straight substrate.  Subcontractor to verify at this time that proper backing is provided for cabinet installation. Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Superintendent of all concerns and/or deficiencies in writing prior to installation.  
007: 
DELIVERY
008: 
Subcontractor shall deliver directly to and install in each unit, all required wall cabinets, base cabinets, bathroom cabinets, face frames, and linens, if applicable.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for delivery F.O.B. the jobsite and storage of cabinets and materials, until said items are installed.  In the process of distributing materials, Subcontractor shall not store or stack his materials in any manner that may hinder or increase the work of any other Subcontractor.
009: 
FABRICATION
010: 
All wall, base, pantries, and bath cabinets shall be fabricated utilizing solid material for all door frames and filler.  All stained grade cabinets - (doors, drawers and side panels) - shall be of the same material.  There will be no mixed species of materials.  
011: 
All cabinet work shall be thoroughly sanded, securely screwed and glued.  Face frames, doors and drawer faces shall be free of stains.  Sharp edges shall be eased and all surfaces shall be pre-finished prior to job delivery and installation.  All nails and screws shall be firmly set and countersunk.
012: 
All cabinets shall be pre-finished prior to delivery to jobsite.
013: 
Toe kick veneer shall compliment the cabinet finish.  Toe kicks shall fit tight to all walls.
014: 
All shelving, solid and adjustable, shall be 5/8" installed tight to walls.  Gaps greater than 1/32" will not be accepted.  Shelving and cabinets shall be free of defects, voids, chips and imperfections, tightly butted together with applied molding at the leading edge or a factory pressure filled edge as approved by Contractor. 
015: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all necessary trim and scribe molding.
016: 
All bottoms of upper cabinets, which are exposed (above eye level) such as cabinet uppers and refrigerator uppers shall be filled, no gaps or openings.  
017: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install door silencers, ie. Silicone pads, for all cabinet doors and drawers.
018: 
Contractor has determined that corbels are required at certain high bar locations, said corbels shall be screwed through the backs and down through plywood rough top.  
019: 
Subcontractor shall supply matching base shoe for all kitchen, bathroom, and vanity  cabinets, to be installed by others.
020: 
INSTALLATION
021: 
Subcontractor's work shall be installed pursuant to the best trade practices, scribed to the wall or neatly fitted with approved scribe molding.  Cabinets shall be square, level, and plumb within ¼" in 10 feet in any direction.
022: 
Fasteners must not be over used or long enough to damage utilities hidden within walls.
023: 
Subcontractor shall install kitchen cabinets so that there is a minimum 18" between the bottom of the cabinet uppers and the finished countertop height. 
024: 
Subcontractor shall install a hanger/stiff back or cleat under counter top where return cabinets meet in corners, to support the countertop weight. 
025: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
026: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.

Company Name:Imperial Shade & Venetian Blind Co.


ProjectName: 2700 S Figueroa ProjectID = 39

Subcontractor:Imperial Shade & Venetian Blind Co.

Trade:Ceramic Tile

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
SPECIFIC - CERAMIC TILE
002: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
003: 
Subcontractor shall install ceramic tile in accordance with manufacturers’ recommendations, industry standards with no visible blemishes.  All work performed to complete satisfaction of Project Owner and Contractor.  
004: 
Subcontractor shall prepare subfloor for the installation of ceramic tile, includes all labor to sanding and filling floors as necessary.
005: 
Subcontractor shall review storage, set-up, and approved prep work locations with Contractor’s Superintendent.
006: 
Subcontractor shall field measure and accept areas to receive ceramic tile prior to installation.  Any discrepancies in adjacent surfaces, such as not being plumbed and level must be brought to the attention of Contractor’s Superintendent prior to the start of work.  
007: 
MATERIALS
008: 
Expanded Metal Lath shall be 2.5 pound flat expanded type, complying with ANSI A42.4.
009: 
Portland Cement: Type I or II, conforming to ASTM C-150, in its proper proportion.
010: 
Grout shall comply with requirements of ANSI A108.10 unless otherwise indicated.
011: 
Sand shall conform to ASTM C-144 in its proper proportion.
012: 
Water clear and potable, taken from a supply for domestic use.
013: 
Mortar Bed – Portland cement and sand mixture, complying with specified method and ANSI A108.1B.
014: 
Metal Transition Trim  – Ceramic Tile to Carpet and/or Hardwood shall be Schluter Schiene M150 Or Approved Equal
015: 
PRE-INSTALLATION & PROTECTION
016: 
Subcontractor shall protect floor sheeting when using water saws on the project. All saws shall be placed into a water proof tub or a protective floor covering may be used to prevent water damage to the OSB plywood.
017: 
Subcontractor shall remove coatings, including curing compounds that contain soap, wax, oil, or silicone, that are incompatible with tile-setting materials. 
018: 
Subcontractor shall clean all surfaces scheduled to receive tile prior to the start of his tile operations.
019: 
Subcontractor shall fill cracks, holes, and depressions with trowelable leveling and patching compound according to tile-setting material manufacturer’s written instructions.
020: 
Subcontractor shall remove protrusions, bumps, and ridges by sanding or grinding.
021: 
INSTALLATION/GENERAL
022: 
Products shall be compatible and each shall be installed in accordance with both the manufacturer’s specifications and the stipulations and recommendations of the other components of the tile operation, including but not limited to tiling, mixing, grouting, reinforcement, methods, types, etc. of mortar, grout, trowels, etc.  In general, Subcontractor shall adhere to all guidelines set forth by the Tile Council of America’s (TCA) Handbook for Ceramic Tile Installation.” 
023: 
All products shall be delivered in manufacturer’s unopened containers with grade seals unbroken and labels intact.
024: 
Subcontractor shall blend tiles, for tiles exhibiting color variations at project site prior to installation.
025: 
Subcontractor shall lay tile in a grid pattern unless otherwise indicated.  Align joints when adjoining tiles on floor, base, walls, and trim are same size.  Lay out tile work and center tile fields in both directions in each space or wall area.  Adjust to minimize tile cutting and provide uniform joint widths, unless otherwise indicated.
026: 
Tile installation shall be straight, smooth, plumb, level, or properly sloped as applicable. Subcontractor shall set field tiles straight and square with equal grout lines and will keep deficiencies to a minimum. All wall tiles shall be installed plumb and level.
027: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for any defect or defects due to faulty materials and/or workmanship and shall repair/replace at Subcontractor’s cost.
028: 
All mortar shall be cleaned from tile as work progresses and before it sets.  Mortar which may be protruding up into the joints shall be removed. 
029: 
Subcontractor shall immediately remove and replace tile where cracks show at grouting stage.
030: 
All grouting shall be completed the day after the tile is set.
031: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
032: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor’s Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.   
033: 
Ceramiche / Supergres / You / Lotus / 12" x 12"
034: 
Ceramiche / Supergres / You / Tabacco 12" x 12"
035: 
Pastorelli / Opera / Carmen / 12" x 24"
036: 
Emser / Eclipse / Cotton / 12" x 12"
037: 
Emser / Eclipse / Silk / 12" x 12"
038: 
Emser / Eclipse / Tobacco / 12" x 12"
039: 
Emser / Eclipse / Lisetto (Sun) / 3" x 12"
040: 
Grout / Customs / Color TBD
041: 
PICK UP & CLEAN UP
042: 
Subcontractor shall remove all protective covering at commencement of his clean up operations.
043: 
Subcontractor shall wash out all drains which may have accidentally received run off from tile operations.  
044: 
Grout, caulk, or other associated materials shall be cleaned from tile immediately after grouting. A protective coat of neutral cleaning solution – one part cleaner to one part water – or other approved manufacturer recommendations, shall be applied to clean and grouted tile.
045: 
All cement, grout and tile debris shall be removed prior to acceptance by Superintendent.
046: 
EXCLUDED
047: 
The following item(s) are excluded from this:
048: 
Granite counters and backsplash by others
049: 
Wood and rubber baseboard by others
050: 
Precast concrete base, columns, etc.  by others
051: 
Fountain and pool/spa related tiles by others
052: 
Brick veneer and cap by others
053: 
Exterior tile at entry arch and slate tile at pilaster caps
054: 
Carpet, resilient, VCT flooring by others
055: 
Marble thresholds at unit bathrooms have been deleted
056: 
Tile at on-grade planter 
057: 
Tile base at exterior areas of podium level

Alternates


Exclusions



Schedule of Values

001 : Approved Submittal  : 3000.0000 : 09030000
002 : Elevator Cabs #1, 2, & 3 : 2625.0000 : 09030000
003 : Subterranean Garage Lobby #1 : 3700.0000 : 09030000
004 : Ground Level Main Lobby, Restroom, Gallery, & Lobby #2 : 58200.0000 : 09030000
005 : 2nd Floor Elevator Lobby & Restrooms : 21780.0000 : 09030000
006 : 3rd Floor Podium  : 114250.0000 : 09030000
007 : 3rd Floor Recreation Room/Lounge Restrooms : 8750.0000 : 09030000
008 : Close out Documentation : 2000.0000 : 09030000

Original Contract Amount: 214305.0000

001 : Common Area Finishes (Elevator Lobby CT) : 8000.0000 : 01 - Approved
002 : Furnish & install porcelain tile : 6000.0000 : 01 - Approved

Revised Contract Amount: 228305.0000

________________________________





Company Name:Imperial Shade & Venetian Blind Co.


ProjectName: Coventry Court - Tustin ProjectID = 41

Trade:Ceramic Tile

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 6:00PM and Saturday 9:00AM to 5:00PM and no work on Sunday.   No costs for overtime or premium time shall be allowed or accepted.
002: 
Subcontractor shall install ceramic tile in accordance with manufacturers’ recommendations, industry standards with no visible blemishes.  All work performed to complete satisfaction of Project Owner and Contractor.  
003:

Company Name:General Construction Clean-up


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:General Construction Clean-up

Trade:Clean Up - Rough & Final

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
GENERAL
002: 
Subcontractor shall remove waste materials from around buildings, all units, corridors, laundry rooms, offices, community rooms, and other common areas as requested by Cobalt Superintendent and remove said waste materials from the project. 
003: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
004: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
005: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
006: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
007: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
008: 
The intent of this contract is for the Subcontractor to be on the job continuously and to keep the jobsite extremely clean.  The list of items is only intended to itemize the majority of work to be performed and is not intended to list move-ins.
009: 
MATERIALS/METHODS
010: 
It is Subcontractor’s responsibility to use cleaning products which are compatible with the surface to be cleaned and with any adjoining areas.  Subcontractor shall consult with Contractor’s Superintendent if there is a question about the manufacturer’s cleaning recommendations and shall be held responsible for any damage which results in the incorrect use of cleaning products. 
011: 
SITE CLEAN UP
012: 
Subcontractor shall remove all trash and waste materials and trench around building to facilitate the erection of exterior scaffolding; after the Stucco Subcontractor’s plastering operation is completed all excess plaster material shall be pulled away from building approximately 2' by others and this Subcontractor shall pickup and  haul offsite all plaster debris including all miscellaneous trash within the scaffold areas.
013: 
Subcontractor shall remove wire, paper, and clean the exterior, including roofs and balconies, of the building after Roofing and Stucco Subcontractors have performed their operations.  Subcontractor shall load and haul offsite all scrap lumber, debris, and waste stucco. 
014: 
Subcontractor shall pick up all trash, debris, and prepare for finish grading operations, flatwork, and landscape by others.
015: 
Subcontractor shall haul off and dispose of one (1) load of concrete, masonry, and block components from project site.
016: 
PRODUCTION SWEEPS
017: 
Subcontractor shall perform the following three (3) production sweeps as directed by Project Superintendent: 
018: 
a.      At rough framing inspection/drywall stocking 
019: 
b.      Prior to lightweight concrete operations
020: 
c.       Prior to Painting Subcontractor’s prime coat and enamel application   
021: 
ROUGH CLEANING OPERATIONS 
022: 
Subcontractor shall perform rough cleaning operations in both the residential units and common area and accomplish the following, but not limited to, list of items:
023: 
a.      Remove from building all debris and wood scraps produced by Rough Framing operations. 
024: 
b.      Clean up building interiors after Rough Carpentry Subcontractor is complete with floor and roof sheathing.   Floors shall be swept clean prior to rough M.E.P.  installation.   Subcontractor shall load and haul offsite all scrap wood and debris.  
025: 
c.       Prior to drywall hanging operations all wall spaces, Subcontractor shall sweep and vacuum all HVAC shafts and ducts.  
026: 
d.      Clean exterior and interior after Stucco and Drywall Subcontractors have completed their operations, remove all combustible and non-combustible materials and haul off site, and sweep areas designated to receive lightweight concrete. 
027: 
e.      Clean the interior of all casework, medicine cabinets, and closets.
028: 
f.        Clean tub/shower units pursuant to Superintendent’s direction. 
029: 
g.      Clean all finish plumbing and electrical fixtures including but not limited to sinks, tubs, drains, and faucets etc. 
030: 
h.      Clean all aluminum and glazing at Storefront, Curtain wall, sliding glass doors, and windows inside and outside, and remove window stickers. No metal blades or metal scrapers to be used on glass.  Subcontractor shall vacuum all door sills and window sills and be careful not to scratch any surfaces.
031: 
i.        Sweep all patios, front steps, and walk ways.
032: 
j.        Subcontractor shall, after all trades are completely finished, sweep and remove all remaining debris leaving units and common areas entirely clean. 
033: 
k.       Appliance boxes and cartons shall be collected and either disposed of by Appliance Subcontractor or placed in onsite trash containers and hauled off by this Subcontractor. 
034: 
FINAL CLEANING OPERATIONS
035: 
Subcontractor shall report any tears, chips, scratches, cracks, cuts, dents, major stains or otherwise damaged surfaces to Contractor’s Superintendent, in writing, prior to and during the cleaning process.
036: 
Subcontractor shall perform final cleaning operations in both the residential units and common area and accomplish the following, but not limited to, list of items:
037: 
a.      Remove all minor paint, sheetrock mud, adhesive, dirt, labels, ink and pencil marks, minor stains and smudges from interior and exterior finish surfaces.
038: 
b.      Dust interior and exterior light fixtures, adjacent shades, and window sills.
039: 
c.       Clean all receptacles, switch covers, phone, and cable outlet covers.
040: 
d.      Wipe down all doors, including but not limited to unit entry, closet, storage, and common area doors and polish all hardware.
041: 
e.      Vacuum and dust all carpets and baseboards.
042: 
f.        Sweep and clean all vinyl and resilient flooring.
043: 
g.      Clean toilets with disinfectant.
044: 
h.      Dust interior and exterior light fixtures, adjacent shades, and window sills.
045: 
i.        Clean and polish all plumbing fixtures and countertops, hardware including faucets, towel bars, shower rods, and paper holders.
046: 
j.        Clean all mirrors and mirrored medicine cabinets. 
047: 
k.       Vacuum and dust interiors and exteriors of all cabinets, closet shelves and medicine cabinets. 
048: 
l.        Wipe down all appliances and install drip pans and burners at ranges.
049: 
m.    Wipe thresholds clean and remove minor paint or mortar.
050: 
n.      Collect, wipe down, and place all instruction manuals intended for prospective resident in a kitchen cabinet drawer.
051: 
o.      Clean and polish interior elevator surfaces.
052: 
p.      Clean all aluminum and glazing at Storefront, Curtain wall, sliding glass doors and windows inside and outside, including the interior storefront windows in the community room, office, and laundry.
053: 
MOVE-IN CLEAN OPERATIONS
054: 
Subcontractor shall perform one (1) move-in clean pursuant to Superintendent’s direction and schedule.
055: 
Move-in Clean must be accepted by Contractor’s Superintendent prior to billing.
056: 
GARAGE AREA
057: 
Subcontractor shall sweep and perform two (2) power wash applications to subterranean garages pursuant to Superintendent's direction. 
058: 
EXCLUSIONS
059: 
The following work is excluded from this contract:
060: 
a.      Prelim and bulk drywall scraps shall be removed by Drywall Subcontractor.
061: 
b.      Landscape waste shall be removed by Landscape Subcontractor.
062: 

063: 

064:

Exclusions

003 : Rough Clean 2nd Floor : 4250.0000 : 02999910
004 : Rough Clean 3rd Floor : 4250.0000 : 02999910
005 : Rough Clean 4th Floor : 4250.0000 : 02999910
006 : Rough Clean Roof : 4250.0000 : 02999910
007 : Rough Clean Fiberglass Tubs & Showers : 3250.0000 : 02999910
008 : Rough Clean Windows : 3250.0000 : 02999910
009 : Rough Clean Exterior : 3250.0000 : 02999910

012 : Rough Clean Rebound Stucco : 3250.0000 : 02999910
013 : Rough Clean Debris prior to Landscape Operations : 3250.0000 : 02999910
014 : Final Clean 1st Floor : 2500.0000 : 02999910
015 : Final Clean 2nd Floor : 2500.0000 : 02999910

________________________________





Company Name:Tahiti Cabinets, Inc.


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Tahiti Cabinets, Inc.

Trade:Clubhouse Millwork

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
In general, cabinetry fabrication, pre-finishing, assembly, and installation shall conform to or supersede W.I.C.   written guidelines.  Cabinetry shall be installed true, square, plumb, level, and firmly anchored for a long life under hard use.  Any manufacturered materials (ie. hinges, screws, guides, plywood, particle board, hardboard, melamine, etc. shall be handled and installed pursuant to manufacturer's requirements and instructions for that specific use and confirm to Project Specification requirements.
002: 
Before field measuring and prior to manufacturing, Subcontractor shall verify with the Project Superintendent all dimensions for (i) appliance openings, (ii) range vents, (iii) plumbing lavatory and sink sizes, (iv)convenience outlets, (v) dishwasher service, (vi) soffits, (vii) HVAC and electrical lines, (viii) and any other possible trade needing coordination.  
003: 
Subcontractor to coordinate with Contractor in writing at or before rough framing all required backing locations, which will be installed by others.
004: 
Subcontractor is responsible at the time of measurements to check floors, walls, ceilings and soffits to which cabinets attach and/or abut to, for level and straight substrate.  Subcontractor to verify at this time that proper backing is provided for cabinet installation. Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Superintendent of all concerns and/or deficiencies in writing prior to installation.  
005: 
DELIVERY
006: 
Subcontractor shall deliver directly to and install to the jobsite and storage of cabinets and materials, until said items are installed.  In the process of distributing materials, Subcontractor shall not store or stack his materials in any manner that may hinder or increase the work of any other Subcontractor.
007: 
FABRICATION
008: 
All cabinet work shall be thoroughly sanded, securely screwed and glued.  Doors and drawer faces shall be free of stains.  Sharp edges shall be eased and all surfaces shall be pre-finished prior to job delivery and installation.  All nails and screws shall be firmly set and countersunk.
009: 
All cabinets shall be pre-finished prior to delivery to jobsite.
010: 
Toe kick veneer shall compliment the cabinet finish.  Toe kicks shall fit tight to all walls.
011: 
All shelving, solid and adjustable, shall be 5/8" installed tight to walls.  Gaps greater than 1/8" will not be accepted.  Shelving and cabinets shall be free of defects, voids, chips and imperfections, tightly butted together with applied molding at the leading edge or a factory pressure filled edge as approved by Contractor. 
012: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all necessary trim and scribe molding.
013: 
All bottoms of upper cabinets, which are exposed (above eye level) such as cabinet uppers and refrigerator uppers shall be filled, no gaps or openings.  
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install door silencers, ie. Silicone pads, for all cabinet doors and drawers.
015: 
INSTALLATION
016: 
Subcontractor's work shall be installed pursuant to the best trade practices, scribed to the wall or neatly fitted with approved scribe molding.  Cabinets shall be square, level, and plumb within ¼" in 10 feet in any direction.
017: 
Fasteners must not be over used or long enough to damage utilities hidden within walls.
018: 
Subcontractor shall install kitchen cabinets so that there is a minimum 18" between the bottom of the cabinet uppers and the finished countertop height. 
019: 
Subcontractor shall install a hanger/stiff back or cleat under counter top where return cabinets meet in corners, to support the countertop weight. 
020: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
021: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with Interior Designer for clarification and approval of all necessary details and accessories. 
022: 
Finish:  Lacquer finish
023: 
Type of Frame:  European Frameless 
024: 
Door Style:  Flat Panel
025: 
Drawer Fronts:  Flat Panel
026: 
Door & Drawer Pulls:  TBD
027: 
Crown Molding:  Approx. 3" square molding
028: 
Hinges:  Self-closing, concealed  
029: 
Drawer Box & Guide:  Soft close
030: 
Drawer Box & Guide at Office filing cabinets:  Heavy duty 
031: 
Cabinet Interior Finish:  White 
032: 
Shelving:  Adjustable at upper & lowers. 
033: 
PLAN CLARIFICATIONS
034: 
The casework included in this scope of work is as follows:
035: 
CGI-01 Leasing Center Amoeba Genius Bar / White & Red Lacquer Finish with millwork pony wall supports
036: 
CGI-02 Leasing Offices Built-in Desks / White Lacquer w/ grommets 
037: 
CGI-04 Built-in Cubbies at Fitness room / White Lacquer
038: 
CGI-05 Kitchen Cabinets & Appliance Wall / Black Lacquer including 3/4" glass countertop & stainless steel supports
039: 
CGI-06 Media Unit at Clubroom / White Lacquer with rolling "garage" doors & locks
040: 
Support, structure, & 5/8" rough top for clubroom restroom counters
041: 
Support, structure, & 5/8" rough top for pool restroom counters
042: 
PROTECTION OF WORK
043: 
Cabinets delivered during rainy weather shall be free of water spots.  No knots, pitch pockets or other defects shall be allowed.
044: 
PICK UP & CUSTOMER SERVICE
045: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
046: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent. 
047: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for that cost if replaced by others.   
048: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor. 
049: 
Subcontractor shall correct any discrepancies in his work and leave the insides of cabinets and surrounding areas clean and acceptable by Project Superintendent.  
050: 
Before acceptance of cabinets by Contractor and prior to Owner walk through, Subcontractor shall have all pick-up work complete; such as alignment and adjustment of tall doors and drawers, replacement of any damaged or defective rollers and guides, replacement of any warped or bowed doors, repair and touch-up of any chips, scratches, dents etc., and a complete installation of any missing materials, molding, trim scribe moldings, hardware, hinges, etc.
051: 
Subcontractor understands and agrees to perform customer service work for one (1) year from Notice of Completion relating to materials and/or workmanship.

Company Name:Seacon Construction Inc


ProjectName: 2700 S Figueroa ProjectID = 39

Subcontractor:Seacon Construction Inc

Trade:Concrete Curb, Gutter, Hardscape & Pavers

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
SPECIFIC - CONCRETE HARDSCAPE 
002: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all site move-ons as needed in order to complete the scope of work.
003: 
All colored concrete and natural colored concrete shall be poured and finished in accordance with plans and specifications and City standard specifications.
004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, material, and tools, to provide saw-cut and score lines in accordance with plans and specifications and Contractor's approval.  
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all handicap ramps.  Ramps shall maintain sloping and clearances in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and all agencies having jurisdiction.
006: 
If necessary, Subcontractor shall provide concrete pumps to facilitate the placing of concrete flatwork.
007: 
Subcontractor shall receive all grades at plus or minus .20' from Contractor.  Minor grading and sloping with Subcontractor's sand layer included.
008: 
All form lumber shall be supplied by Subcontractor.  All form lumber shall be stripped and hauled away by Subcontractor.
009: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install any and all ties, wire, strong backs, fasteners, glue, mastic cement, expansion joints, zip strips, foam or any other material or accessory required to complete his scope of work.
010: 
Hardscape areas must have adequate slope as to appease all drainage and ADA requirements.
011: 
Subcontractor shall place and finish all concrete without visible defects or depressions.  Concrete shall be sloped to drain in accordance with plans and specifications.  
012: 
Any cracked concrete not acceptable by Owner shall be immediately replaced.  Contractor acknowledges that minor hairlines cracks are normal.  Hairline cracks are cracks that are a "dime" thick or less.  No spalding or uplifting shall be accepted.
013: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all concrete pumping, including washout pits.  Subcontractor shall haul away all concrete waste from washout area.  
014: 
Subcontractor shall provide flagman during his curb and gutter operations.  
015: 
MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
016: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  
017: 
Ackerstone / Antique Brown 12" x 12" Square 60mm 
018: 
Davis Color / 6804 Cliffside Brown 
019: 
Concrete Designs Inc. / AW5-72
020: 
ON GRADE OPERATIONS
021: 
Subcontractor shall demo existing curb, gutter, and sidewalk.
022: 
Subcontractor shall install curb and gutter on Figueroa and 27th St. but curb only on Flower.  
023: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install 4" thick colored concrete with broom finish over 4" class II base with no rebar at the sidewalk locations.
024: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install interlocking paver bands over 4" of mortar base.  
025: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install precast decorative planter and concrete basin.
026: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install 6" thick drive approaches with colored concrete in a broom finish over 6" class II base with no rebar.
027: 
Subcontracontractor shall furnish and install tree grate footings 8" thick 18" deep with 2 each #4 rebar.  Iron angles shall be supplied by others but installed by this subcontractor. 
028: 
SUSUMP PLANTER AREA
029: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install 4" bottom section of foundation in regular grey concrete with wood trowel finish with #4 rebar at 24" on center. 
030: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install PIP wall per details including drill and dowel into CMU wall & building wall, and top section with regular grey concrete 5" thick with a broom finish and #4 rebar at 16." 
031: 
Subcontractor shall install a cold joint between the sidewalk and PIP wall section.
032: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install regular grey broom finish concrete steps over 2" fill sand with #3 rebar at 24" on center. 
033: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install regular grey concrete 4" thick over class II base with #4 rebar around transformer pad and switch pad at S/E at  building corner.
034: 
ON PODIUM OPERATIONS
035: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install regular grey 6" thick float finish with #4 rebar at 24" on center inside landscape planters.
036: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install concrete strip between planter walls and building walls with no rebar.
037: 
OPTION(S)
038: 
Subcontractor shall perform 12" wide strip of asphalt patching along Figueroa and 27th St.'s new curb and gutter only for $4,400.00.  Flower concrete patching is not included in this price.

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Subcontractors shall work at jobsite Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  No additional costs for overtime or premium time shall be accepted if subcontractor is at fault when behind schedule only.  Subcontractor agrees to properly man the project to avoid the requirement for Saturday work.
002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools, equipment and facilities to provide complete Concrete and Ackerstone Pavers for Buildings No. 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, Club House and Pool House in accordance with plans except as noted, specifications, state and local codes and all agencies having jurisdiction.
003: 
Subcontractor is fully aware of the SWPPP requirements regarding contamination to the soils around each building from their operations and shall be responsible for any violations resulting in the performance of the WORK.  Any removal or damage to existing  SWPPP protections in-place on the Project by the Subcontractor during the performance of the WORK will be the responsibility of the Subcontractor.
004: 
It is hereby understood that the structures covered herein are to be built as shown on the approved plans and this scope of work, any variations or discrepancies noted shall be immediately brought to the attention of Contractor's Representative and resolved. No deviations regarding the design or structural integrity of the building are acceptable. 
005: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all site move-ons as needed in order to complete the scope of work.  Subcontractor has allowed for 5 move ins for buildings and surrounding walkways.  Additional move ins my be neccessary for the Pool Area, Clubhouse and street pavers & V-Gutter.  The Clubhouse and pool should be able to be corridinated to fit within the 5 move ins.

All colored concrete and natural colored concrete shall be poured and finished in accordance with plans and specifications and City standard specifications.

013: 
Subcontractor shall place and finish all concrete without visible defects or depressions.  Concrete shall be sloped to drain in accordance with plans and specifications.  
014: 
Any cracked concrete not acceptable by Owner shall be immediately replaced.  Contractor acknowledges that minor hairlines cracks are normal.  Hairline cracks are cracks that are a "dime" thick or less.  No spalding or uplifting shall be accepted.

Company Name:Seacon Construction Inc


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:Seacon Construction Inc

Trade:Concrete Walks, Hardscape & Topping Slabs

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Subcontractors shall work at jobsite Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 8:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. (If required by general contractor).  No costs for overtime or premium time shall be accepted.  
002: 
This is a “Prevailing Wage” Project. Subcontractor has fully explored the requirements of this project and has included all labor costs associated with those findings. Labor Costs shall include but are not limited to, hourly rates, vacation rates, apprentice training programs, penalties assessed for improper record keeping, etc.
003: 
Ownership is seeking LEED Silver Compliance on this project.  All accociated LEED costs are included in this subcontract agreement.
004: 
Subcontractor shall provide for parking off-site (if required) for all employees with no compensation from General Contractor.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor to properly supervise, schedule, coordinate, oversee delivery, hoisting, placing and provide quaility control for the complete installation of all reinforcing materials and concrete masonry work to the finished podium elevation in accordance with plans, specifications and all agencies having jusrisdiction.  
006:

Company Name:Stevens Cresto Engineering, Inc.


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Stevens Cresto Engineering, Inc.

Trade:Construction Staking

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Move-ins required to perform the staking will be in accordance with Contractor's construction schedule. Contractor to provide one (1) week notice to Engineer/Surveyor for the initial staking request at the beginning of the project and two (2) business days minimum advance notice for each subsequent required staking visit. Contractor to provide 1-week notice to Engineer/Surveyor for the initial staking
002: 
One set of stakes will be provided for each of the items listed above. Staking for pipelines and curbs will be provided at fifty foot (50') intervals on straight sections, twenty-five foot (25') intervals on curves, together with angle points and structures. 
003: 
It is understood that coordination of Surveying with related contractors will occur through the Project Superintendent.
004: 
Any re-staking or staking of items not included in the Scope of Services will be Additional Services and be subject to additional charges.  Additional Services will be performed on an hourly basis per the rate schedule in affect at the time of Additional Services; 
005: 
Only those items listed above are included in the Base Contract Amount. Any other items called for in the specifications or otherwise required by Contractor (if any) will be provided as Additional Services. 
006: 
Cut slopes stakes are set at the top of slope. Fill slope stakes are set at an offset to the toe of slope.
007: 
Cut/fill information relates to finished floor, top of curb, finished surface. They are not given to sub-grade or sub-base.
008: 
Dry utilities structures will only be staked based on precise locational information provided by others. 
009: 
Staking for joint trench (electric, gas, phone, cable) will be provided in the form of curb stakes or finish grade stakes along the trench route and or in proximity to structures. 
010: 
Field time expended in performance of Additional Services (if any) will be acknowledged by the Project Superintendent on an Extra Staking Ticket for each occurrence and copies will be provided with each monthly billing.
011: 
SITE WORK STAKING, LOTS 1, 2, & 4 
012: 
Office calculations.
013: 
Provide cut sheets and a plan showing the location of stakes set. 
014: 
Establish and maintain secondary horizontal and vertical control. 
015: 
Clear and grub staking along the northerly, southerly and westerly project property lines, every 50' or at angle points. The easterly project property line is already defined by improvements on the adjacent property. 
016: 
Rough grade staking for lot I parking structure excavation. This is staking the ramp and the cut slope around the perimeter of the building. Stakes to be set at top of cut slope or at an offset for fill slopes. 
017: 
Fine grade staking for lot I parking structure excavation. This is staking for fine grading the building pad and setting curb stakes for fine grading the roads to the east and west of the building. 
018: 
Rough grade staking for lots 2 and 4. 
019: 
Fine grade staking for lots 2 and 4. 
020: 
Pad certification for lot I excavation & Lots 2 & 4 pads. 
021: 
Sewer staking. 
022: 
Storm drain staking.
023: 
Water and fire mains staking. This includes fire hydrants and staking curbs for the setting of water meters. All other fire and water appurtenances are excluded.
024: 
Joint Trench and Electric structures. See condition below.
025: 
Retaining wall along the easterly property line.
026: 
Staking retaining walls and storm drain around the pool area.
027: 
Curb stakes.
028: 
PARK SITE, LOT 3 
029: 
Rough grade staking and pad certification. 
030: 
Public Storm Drain staking from Lightwave thru Park. 
031: 
Water line staking from Lightwave to NW corner of Park.
032: 
BUILDINGS & PARKING STRUCTURE, LOT 1 
033: 
Stakes for the parking structure control are to be set in the ground or on a horizontal concrete surface, not on the vertical face of the building walls. If this is required it will be done on an hourly basis. 
034: 
Parking Structure staking in the following three areas. 
035: 
Area 1:  North / South grid lines 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, & 14
036: 
Area 1:  East/ West grid lines A, C, F, G, J & M.
037: 
Area 2: North / South grid lines 13,15, 16, 18, 20 & 22
038: 
Area 2: East/ West grid lines A, B, C and E.
039: 
Area 3: North / South grid lines 21, 24, 26, 28, 30, 33 & 34
040: 
Area 3: East/ West grid lines A, C, F, G, J and M.
041: 
One set of grid fine stakes as listed above, at the basement level, around the perimeter of the building set outside the building walls.
042: 
One set of grid fine stakes as listed above, at the basement level, around the perimeter of the building set inside the building walls for the parking structure. 
043: 
One set of grid line stakes as listed above, on the top of the podium for timber construction. 
044: 
For the 3 items above, it is intended that each area to be staked in one visit for each set of stakes. Additional visits for the same scope of work will be done subject to additional charges on an hourly basis for the additional travel and set up time. 
045: 
Leasing building, grid lines R1, R3, R4, R5, R6, R7, R9, and RA, RB, RC. 
046: 
D. Podium, Lot I 
047: 
Staking for Podium storm drain catch basins 
048: 
Staking for the Podium planter walls. 
049: 
EXHIBIT "A"
050: 
Stevens Crespo Engineering, Inc. Standard Fee Schedule is attached herein and made a part hereto as Exhibit "A" to Contract Purchase Order.

Company Name:Imperial Shade & Venetian Blind Co.


ProjectName: 2700 S Figueroa ProjectID = 39

Subcontractor:Imperial Shade & Venetian Blind Co.

Trade:Countertops

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  No costs for overtime or premium time shall be allowed or accepted.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor, materials tools, supplies and equipment to unload material delivered to project site and distribute to units for installation.  Any and all hoisting is Subcontractor's responsibility.  Subcontractor shall work with Contractor's Superintendent for coordination of delivery and Subcontractor's access requirements. 
003: 
Contractor shall provide Subcontractor a reasonably secure area on site to store and/or stage subcontractors' materials, if needed.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for the security of his materials and equipment.
004: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with Contractor's Superintendent, delivery, storage, and installation procedures. 
005: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all materials until final installation and acceptance by Contractor.  Any loss due to theft or breakage prior to acceptance by Contractor shall be replaced by Subcontractor at no additional cost to Contractor.
006: 
Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Superintendent of any damage to base, walls, cabinets, doors, ceramic etc. prior to starting work.  Exact damage must be noted on work order and Contractor's Superintendent's signature obtained.
007: 
Subcontractor shall verify areas to be installed by verifying his work order and finish floor plan and refer any discrepancies to Contractor's Superintendent.  Subcontractor shall verify he has adequate material by measuring layout before cutting material and starting installation. 
008: 
Subcontractor shall not place tools, base shoe or tack strips on countertops, tubs, shower floors, water closets, vinyl or any finished surface.
009: 
Subcontractor shall verify the cabinets are installed plumb and true prior to installation.  Subcontractor shall not install over poor craftsmanship. Subcontractor shall insure that the countertops shall be flat, level, and true.
010: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate electrical cut outs with the Electrical Subcontractor.  All electrical cut outs are part of this contract.
011: 
GRANITE SHOP DRAWINGS
012: 
Subcontractor shall submit to Contractor shop drawings indicating granite countertop layout for each unit type.  Shop drawings shall standardize seam locations.  Subcontractor shall coordinate the shop drawings with the rough framing and the cabinet shop drawings.  Subcontractor agrees to work closely with Contractor and the Cabinet Subcontractor to verify the countertop dimensions.
013: 
GRANITE MATERIAL APPROVALS
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish Owner a sample of granite material to be selected and approved for installation.  Upon Owner's approval of the selected material sample, Subcontractor shall locate the appropriate granite slabs in the required quantity to complete the project and forward Owner additional samples for final approval.
015: 
Deviation from approved material samples will be cause for potential rejection and replacement
016: 
GRANITE INSTALLATION
017: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install granite countertops and splashes at all kitchen and bathroom pullmans.  Subcontractor shall furnish and install all common area countertops per plan.
018: 
Subcontractor shall provide the necessary power needed if the building electricity has not been activated prior to the scheduled installation.
019: 
All granite shall be installed in accordance with standard practices.  Seams shall be no greater than 1/8" in thickness and will be filled with matching seam filler and invisible to the eye.  All edges shall be clean and straight.
020: 
Subcontractor agrees to fabricate all countertops 2" longer and field cut to fit.  However, there are countertops where Subcontractor and Contractor shall mutually agree that were there are finished edges on each end, we will have to "hold-to" certain dimensions.  Subcontractor shall supply Contractor a list of these areas on the countertop shop drawings.  In all other cases, any countertops fabricated too short will be rejected and replaced at the sole cost of this Subcontractor.
021: 
All sink holes shall be field cut.  No sink cut outs shall be performed at the factory.  Cut outs for the plumbing fixtures are part of this Subcontract Agreement.
022: 
Jointing at granite countertops to be mutually agreed upon prior to installation.
023: 
Contractor will inspect groups on installed units within one (1) week of Subcontractor's installation.  Once Contractor deems the product and installation acceptable, Subcontractor shall cover work with adhesive plastic protection.
024: 
All countertop edges shall be manufactured to provide a smooth edge free of defects and blemishes.
025: 
PRODUCT & MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
026: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor of the changes in writing.   Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
027: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS
028: 
Material:  Granite
029: 
Color:  Santa Cecilia Or Approved equal
030: 
Edge Profie:  1-1/2" thick flat polished edge detail at all exposed edges, except where edges butt with appliances.  
031: 
Backsplash:  6" at back splash at all kitchens, 4" at bath and vanity pullman countertops.  All exposed edges of splash shall be flat polished
032: 
COMMON AREA
033: 
Material:  DuPont Zodiaq Quartz
034: 
Color:  Papyrus
035: 
Edge Profie:  1-1/2" thick flat polished edge detail at all exposed edges.  
036: 
Backsplash:  None

Alternates


Exclusions

001: 
The following item(s) are excluded from this Subcontractor
002: 
Residential unit rough tops at kitchen, bath, & vanity


Schedule of Values

Company Name:Richfield, Inc.


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Richfield, Inc.

Trade:Countertops

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  No costs for overtime or premium time shall be allowed or accepted.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor, materials tools, supplies and equipment to unload material delivered to project site and distribute to units for installation.  Any and all hoisting is Subcontractor's responsibility.  Elevators will not be available for spreading of material.  Subcontractor shall work with Contractor's Superintendent for coordination of delivery and Subcontractor's access requirements.   
003: 
Contractor shall provide Subcontractor a reasonably secure area on site to store and/or stage subcontractors' materials, if needed.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for the security of his materials and equipment.
004: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all materials until final installation and acceptance by Contractor.  Any loss due to theft or breakage prior to acceptance by Contractor shall be replaced by Subcontractor at no additional cost to Contractor.
005: 
Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Superintendent of any damage to base, walls, cabinets, doors, ceramic etc. prior to starting work.  Exact damage must be noted on work order and Contractor's Superintendent's signature obtained.
006: 
Subcontractor shall verify areas to be installed by verifying his work order and finish floor plan and refer any discrepancies to Contractor's Superintendent.  
007: 
Subcontractor shall not place tools or equipment on countertops, tubs, shower floors, water closets, vinyl or any finished surface.
008: 
Subcontractor shall verify the cabinets are installed plumb and true prior to installation.  Subcontractor shall not install over poor craftsmanship. Subcontractor shall insure that the countertops shall be flat, level, and true.
009: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate electrical cut outs with the Electrical Subcontractor.  All electrical cut outs are part of this contract.
010: 
Subcontractor shall order additonal stock material to allow for breakage that may occur during shipment or installation process.  If there is breakage in excess of the additonal material, or if the material is not of acceptable quality, any additonal replacement material shall be obtained locally at no additional cost to Contractor.  
011: 
GRANITE SHOP DRAWINGS
012: 
Subcontractor shall submit to Contractor shop drawings indicating granite countertop layout for each unit type.  Shop drawings shall standardize seam locations.  Subcontractor shall coordinate the shop drawings with the rough framing and the cabinet shop drawings.  Subcontractor agrees to work closely with Contractor and the Cabinet Subcontractor to verify the countertop dimensions.
013: 
GRANITE MATERIAL APPROVALS
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish Owner multiple 12 x 12 material samples to be selected and approved for installation.  Upon Owner's approval of the selected material sample, Subcontractor shall locate the appropriate granite slabs in the required quantity to complete the project and forward Owner additional samples for final approval.
015: 
Deviation from approved material samples will be cause for potential rejection and replacement.  Only minor color variations within each unit will be acceptable and where two pieces are installed next to each other, the grains shall be aligned.  
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide mock up of butt joint for Owner's Approval.  Said mock up shall serve as a minimal acceptable joint.  Layout of joints shall be approved by Owner.
017: 
GRANITE INSTALLATION
018: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install granite countertops and splashes at all kitchen and bathroom pullmans.  
019: 
Subcontractor shall provide the necessary power needed if the building electricity has not been activated prior to the scheduled installation.
020: 
All granite shall be installed in accordance with standard practices.  Seams shall be no greater than 1/8" in thickness and will be filled with matching seam filler and invisible to the eye.  All edges shall be clean and straight.
021: 
At Subcontractor's discretion, certain segments shall be fabricated 2" longer and cut to fit but otherwise all segments are precut to size.  However, there are countertops where Subcontractor and Contractor shall mutually agree that were there are finished edges on each end, we will have to "hold-to" certain dimensions.  Subcontractor shall supply Contractor a list of these areas on the countertop shop drawings.  In all other cases, any countertops fabricated too short will be rejected and replaced at the sole cost of this Subcontractor.
022: 
Subcontractor shall precut all sinks in the factory but perform final cut out shall be performed on the jobsite.  Cut outs for the plumbing fixtures are part of this Subcontract Agreement.  There shall be no cutting or grinding in the units.
023: 
Jointing at granite countertops to be mutually agreed upon prior to installation.
024: 
Contractor will inspect groups on installed units within one (1) week of Subcontractor's installation.  Once Contractor deems the product and installation acceptable, Subcontractor shall cover work with adhesive plastic protection.
025: 
All countertop edges shall be manufactured to provide a smooth edge free of defects and blemishes.
026: 
Gaps between wall and backsplash shall be caulked in color to match granite.  Additonal caulking shall be left with the Jobsite Superientendent for future maintenance.
027: 
All clean-up required due to countertop adjustment or repair shall be the responsibility of this Subcontractor.
028: 
PRODUCT & MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
029: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor of the changes in writing.   Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
030: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS
031: 
Material:  Granite
032: 
Color:  50 % of units to receive Iced Kyanite and 50% to receive Kashmire White
033: 
Edge Profie:  1-1/2" thick flat polished edge detail at all exposed edges, except where edges butt with appliances.  
034: 
Backsplash:  6" back splash at all kitchens, bar tops, and 4" at bath pullman countertops.  All exposed edges of splash shall be flat polished
035: 
EXCLUSIONS
036: 
The following items are excluded from this Subcontract:
037: 
Common area millwork
038: 
Cabinets are part of separate subcontract.

________________________________





Company Name:Ceramic Tile Art


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Ceramic Tile Art

Trade:Countertops - Granite

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
GRANITE OPERATIONS
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor, materials tools, supplies and equipment to unload material delivered to project site and distribute to units for installation.  Any and all hoisting is Subcontractor's responsibility.  Subcontractor shall work with Contractor's Superintendent for coordination of delivery and Subcontractor's access requirements. 
003: 
Contractor shall provide Subcontractor a reasonably secure area on site to store and/or stage subcontractors’ materials, if needed.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for the security of his materials and equipment.
004: 
Upon an agreed directive, coordinated between Contractor and Subcontractor, adequate job site lay down and storage areas will be provided, if available, to Subcontractor to allow Subcontractor to deliver all granite directly to the jobsite from the Port of Long Beach.  Crates of granite will arrive in 20-foot containers (specific dimensions of containers are required) and be off loaded by Subcontractor.  Contractor and Subcontractor shall agree upon a site location which allows Subcontractor to load buildings with Subcontractor's forklift.
005: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with Contractor’s Superintendent, delivery, storage and installation procedures. 
006: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all materials until final installation and acceptance by Contractor.  Any loss due to theft or breakage prior to acceptance by Contractor shall be replaced by Subcontractor at no additional cost to Contractor.
007: 
Subcontractor shall notify Contractor’s Superintendent of any damage to base, walls, cabinets, doors, ceramic etc. prior to starting work.  Exact damage must be noted on work order and Contractor’s Superintendent’s signature obtained.
008: 
Subcontractor shall verify areas to be installed by verifying his work order and finish floor plan and refer any discrepancies to Contractor’s Superintendent.  Subcontractor shall verify he has adequate material by measuring layout before cutting material and starting installation. 
009: 
Subcontractor shall not place tools, base shoe or tack strips on countertops, tubs, shower floors, water closets, vinyl or any finished surface.
010: 
Subcontractor shall verify the cabinets are installed plumb and true prior to installation.  Subcontractor shall not install over poor craftsmanship. Subcontractor shall insure that the countertops shall be flat, level, and true.
011: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate electrical cut outs with the Electrical Subcontractor.  All electrical cut outs are part of this contract.
012: 
GRANITE SHOP DRAWINGS
013: 
Subcontractor shall submit to Contractor shop drawings indicating granite countertop layout for each unit type.  Shop drawings shall standardize seam locations.  Subcontractor shall coordinate the shop drawings with the rough framing and the cabinet shop drawings.  Subcontractor agrees to work closely with Contractor and the Cabinet Subcontractor to verify the countertop dimensions.
014: 
GRANITE MATERIAL APPROVALS
015: 
Subcontractor shall furnish to owner a sample of granite material to be selected and approved for installation.  Upon Owner’s approval of the selected material sample, Subcontractor shall locate the appropriate granite slabs in the required quantity to complete the project and forward Owner additional samples for final approval.
016: 
Deviation from approved material samples will be cause for potential rejection and replacement
017: 
GRANITE INSTALLATION
018: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install granite countertops and splashes at all kitchen and bathroom pullmans.  Subcontractor shall furnish and install all common area countertops per plan.
019: 
 Subcontractor shall provide the necessary power needed if the building electricity has not been activated prior to the scheduled installation.
020: 
All granite shall be installed in accordance with standard practices.  Seams shall be no greater than 1/8" in thickness and will be filled with matching seam filler and invisible to the eye.  All edges shall be clean and straight.
021: 
Subcontractor agrees to fabricate all countertops 2" long and field cut to fit.  However, there are countertops where Subcontractor and Contractor shall mutually agree that were there are finished edges on each end, we will have to "hold-to" certain dimensions.  Subcontractor shall supply Contractor a list of these areas on the countertop shop drawings.  In all other cases, any countertops fabricated too short will be rejected and replaced at the sole cost of this Subcontractor.
022: 
Subcontractor shall provide a 1-1/2” thick bullnose edge detail at all exposed edges, except where edges butt with appliances.  Bullnose, and all other countertop edges, shall be manufactured to provide a smooth edge free of defects and blemishes.
023: 
Subcontractor shall provide a 6" back splash at all kitchens and bar tops, and 4" at bath pullman countertops.  All exposed edges of splash shall be flat polished
024: 
All sink holes shall be field cut.  No sink cut outs shall be performed at the factory.  Cut outs for the plumbing fixtures are part of this Subcontract Agreement.
025: 
Jointing at granite countertops to be mutually agreed upon prior to installation.
026: 
Contractor will inspect groups on installed units within one (1) week of Subcontractor's installation.  Once Contractor deems the product and installation acceptable, Subcontractor shall cover work with adhesive plastic protection.
027: 
All cut edges, either from the factory or field, shall be free from any defects, blemishes, rough or spalled edges. 
028: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
029: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
030: 
a.       Granite Color:  Group 1 ____________ or approved equal. 
031: 
b.      Excluded – Rough tops – shall be provided by others. 
032: 
CONSTRUCTION SCHEDULE
033: 
Subcontractor agrees to conform to the construction schedule.  Subcontractor acknowledges the construction schedule is an evolving process and agrees to a minimum production rate of ten (10) units installed per day.
034: 
CLEAN UP
035: 
Subcontractor shall remove and dispose of all debris generated by their operations.  All granite cutting shall be contained in one area, as dictated by the contractor's superintendent.  Granite cutting shall be in an area away from carpeted and finished areas.  If subcontractor fails to clean up trade daily, the contractor may elect to hire labor to clean up after the subcontractor.  Any and all costs shall be assumed by Subcontractor.  All wet cutting shall be done over tarp protecting and subcontractor must use vacuums during cutting to reduce mud and dust, which will expectedly occur.  Subcontractor shall place all trash and debris in trash containers provided by Contractor.
036: 
Subcontractor shall remove product remnants that are not usable and comply with Owner’s instructions for final disposition of usable remnants.

Alternates


Exclusions

002 : Mobilization : 6000.0000 : 06060500

004 : Install Countertops 2nd Floor : 10580.0000 : 06060500
005 : Install Countertops 3rd Floor : 10580.0000 : 06060500
006 : Install Coutertops 4th Floor : 10580.0000 : 06060500
007 : Install Countertops - Public : 1680.0000 : 06060500

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  No costs for overtime or premium time shall be allowed or accepted.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor, materials tools, supplies and equipment to unload material delivered to project site and distribute to units for installation.
