Company Name:Hale Glass, Inc.


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Hale Glass, Inc.

Trade:Curtain Wall, Storefront System, & Glazing - Misc

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
GENERAL
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide and install an aluminum storefront and curtain wall system that is designed to provide for expansion and contraction of the component materials resulting from a surface temperature range of 180 degrees F without buckling, failure of joint seals, undue stress on structural elements damaging loads on fasteners, reduction of performance, stress on glass, of other detrimental effects.   Entrance doors shall function normally over the specified temperature range.  
003: 
Subcontractor shall design all storefront and curtain wall systems to withstand the design pressures from wind loads, deflection of framing members, seismic episodes, story drift, air infiltration, water penetration thermal movements, and thermal conductance in accordance with the plans, specifications, and all agencies having jurisdiction.
004: 
Subcontractor shall design all storefront systems to meet or exceed the ASTM ratings.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all move-Ins necessary to complete this scope of work
006: 
QUALITY
007: 
Subcontractor shall install all storefront and curtain wall metal plumb and true with no visible gaps between the storefront metal and the adjacent surfaces.
008: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install aluminum with non-staining and non-ferrous shims for aligning system components.
009: 
INSTALLATION - FRAMING MEMBERS
010: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with the Stucco and Masonry Subcontractor in advance of his operations to help yield a straight and level substrate but not install their system until AFTER stucco operations are complete.   
011: 
Subcontractor shall field measure all openings prior to fabrication and notify Contractor’s Superintendent of any major discrepancies or variation from the approved plans.
012: 
Subcontractor shall attach storefront and curtain wall systems to building structures in accordance with the Manufacturer’s written recommendations and any other agencies having jurisdictions.
013: 
Subcontractor shall install all storefront metal plumb and level with no visible gaps between storefront metal and adjacent surfaces.  
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install a backer rod and a suitable caulking where gaps occur between adjacent surfaces and storefront metal.
015: 
Subcontractor shall provide framing members that provide alloy and temper as recommended by product manufacturer for strength and application of required finish, complying with ASTM B221 for extrusions and ASTM B 209 for sheet or plate.   
016: 
Subcontractor shall paint aluminum surfaces in contact with incompatible materials, including mortar, concrete or other masonry with bituminous coating or primer, or by applying sealant or tape recommended by manufacturer.
017: 
INSTALLATION – GLAZING 
018: 
Subcontractor shall set sill members and other members in bed of sealant, or use joint filters or gaskets to provide weather-tight construction.
019: 
EXTERIOR STOREFRONT & CURTAIN WALL SYSTEM FINISH
020: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all storefront and curtain wall systems with Class I bronze anodized aluminum factory finish.  
021: 
GLAZING AT STOREFRONT & CURTAIN WALL LOCATIONS
022: 
Glazing shall be free from bubbles, smoke vanes, air holes, scratches, and other defects.
023: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install 1" Dual glazed ¼" Low E tempered glass over a ¼" clear tempered glass.  All exterior glass shall receive PPG’s Solarban 60.  Glazing shall be installed and sealed with a continuous gasket, to provide a watertight installation in accordance with the manufactures recommendations.
024: 
GLAZING AT FIRE-RATED LOCATIONS
025: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install glazing as referenced on Sheets A6.02 and A6.03 and meet all applicable code and safety requirements.   Glazing shall be installed and sealed with a continuous gasket, to ensure an airtight installation in accordance with the manufacturer’s recommendations.
026: 
Subcontractor shall provide Safti-First Superlite I-W Misco wire glass or Approved Equal.
027: 
HARDWARE
028: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all hardware associated with this scope of work including but not limited to: hinges, locksets, coordinators, mounting brackets, drop plates, door stops, electric strikes/hinges, exit devices, door pulls, rollers, closers, fasteners, tracks, shims, screws, pivot pins, thresholds, weather-stripping, door sweeps, etc.
029: 
Subcontractor shall NOT use exposed fasteners except for installing hardware. For installation of hardware use machine screws that match the finish of the hardware being installed.
030: 
Subcontractor shall provide retaining cap fasteners complying with ASTM A193, Series 300 stainless steel screws, and type as recommended by manufacturer.
031: 
ANTI-GRAFFITI COATING
032: 
Subcontractor shall apply anti-graffiti coating to complete panels of glass on exterior storefront and curtain wall locations on lower 9’ minimum. 
033: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
034: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by an approved change order to this contract.
035: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install curtain wall and storefront systems as referenced on Sheet A6.02 per plans and specifications, including frames, glazing, corner mullions, break metal, doors and all associated hardware.
036: 
TYPE / LOCATION / DESCRIPTION / WORK
037: 
CURTAINWALL SYSTEM  - COMPLETE SYSTEM
038: 
Type S1 / Exterior / Curtainwall System
039: 
Type S1 / Door 101 (A) / NR Glass w/ Hardware Group 1
040: 
Type S1 / Door 102 (B) / NR Glass w/ Hardware Group 7
041: 
Type S2 / Exterior / Curtainwall System
042: 
STOREFRONT SYSTEM - COMPLETE SYSTEM
043: 
Type S6 / Exterior / Storefront System
044: 
Type S7 / Exterior / Storefront System
045: 
Type S8 / Exterior / Storefront System
046: 
Type S9 / Exterior / Storefront System
047: 
Type S9 / Door 108 (B) / NR Glass w/ Hardware Group 8
048: 
Type S11 / Interior Computer / NR Frame & Glazing
049: 
Type S18 / Exterior / Storefront System w/ Awning Windows Obscure & Tempered 
050: 
Type S19 / Exterior / Storefront System w/ Awning Windows Obscure & Tempered 
051: 
Type S20 / Exterior / Storefront System w/ Awning Windows Obscure & Tempered 
052: 
SUPPLY & INSTALL GLAZING ONLY
053: 
Type S3 / Interior 2nd Floor Lobby / 45 min WG
054: 
Type S3 / Door 201 (B) / 20 Min 
055: 
Type S4 / Interior 2nd Floor Lobby / 45 min WG
056: 
Type S5 / Interior 2nd Floor Lobby / 45 min WG
057: 
Type S10 / Interior Laundry / 45 min WG
058: 
Type S12 / Interior Office / 45 Min WG
059: 
Type S13 / Interior Office / 45 Min WG
060: 
Type S14 / Interior Office / 45 Min WG
061: 
Type S14 / Door 103 (B) / 20 Min 
062: 
Type S15 / Interior Office / 45 Min WG

071: 
PLAN CHANGES AND CLARIFICATIONS
072: 
 The specifications outlined in the “Project Manual,” shall take precedence over specifications outlined in this scope of work unless otherwise stated below.  The Project Manual shall be considered a part of the Contract Agreement and it is Subcontractor’s responsibility to clarify discrepancies with Contractor’s Purchasing Department prior to award of contract.  Subcontractor is to review said document for other trades product specification which may affect his work.
073: 
Curtain wall assemblies size shall be greater than 2” w X 4-1/2” d pursuant to Subcontractor’s approved engineering details and shop drawings.
074: 
Hollow metal fire rated frames by Finish Carpenter
075: 
Metal doors by Finish Carpenter
076: 
Windows and Type L sliding patio doors by Window Subcontractor
077: 
Battery Pack for Hardware Group 1 by Electrical Subcontractor
078: 
Key fobs for Hardware Group 1 by Low Voltage Subcontractor
079: 
Sheet A2.01, Keynote #25 break metal between windows by Sheetmetal Subcontractor
080: 
Subcontractor prefers that the Sheet metal Subcontractor does not install the sill pans as referenced on Sheet 2/A7.06 and install their storefront/curtainwall system directly to the substrate.
081: 
MAINTENANCE
082: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a complete set of specialized tools and maintenance instructions as required for the Owner's continued adjustment, maintenance, removal and replacement of entrance door hardware.
083: 
WARRANTY
084: 
Subcontractor shall provide Manufacturer’s warranty that includes warranty against material defects, fogging, loss of transparency and frost-build up between the glass panes due to defective materials or sealant failure after Substantial Completion.
085: 
Subcontractor shall replace materials and repair workmanship during the warranty period at no cost to the Owner.

Company Name:Robert Lunetta Co


ProjectName: Coventry Court - Tustin ProjectID = 41

Subcontractor:Robert Lunetta Co

Trade:Decorative Iron & Structural Steel

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Subcontractors shall work at jobsite Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  (if required by General Contractor to maintain construction schedule) No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all balcony rails per plan and as detailed at the existing buildng.
003: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install decorative arch at the entry to each building as shown in the plan elevation and existing building.
004: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install gate, handrail and gate return at existing perimeter masonry wall.
005: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install structural steel at Clubhouse.  Templates to be supplied by this subcontractor and installed by the concrete subcontractor.
006: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all roof access ladders with lockaable door per plans and specifications as installed at existing builidng.
007: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate and furnish two (2)  pipe bollards at each building to be installed by the concrete subcontractor.
008: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Prime metal elevator pit ladders.
009: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all site fencing and gates at pool area.
010: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install exterior handrails per plan and specifications.
011: 
Subcontractor shall indicate all shop and erection details including cuts, penetrations for pipes and ducts, profiles, sizes, spacing, locations of structural members, openings, attachments, fasteners, and welds.
012: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for submittal to the Engineer of Record for approval.
013: 
Subcontractor shall identify all welded connections, both shop and field, with AWS A 2.4 welding symbols for welding and Non-Destructive Testing.
014: 
Subcontractor shall submit manufacturer's mill certificates and mill test report for all structural steel to be used in the work.
015: 
Subcontractor shall certify all welders employed on the Work, verifying AWS qualification within the previous 12 months in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
016: 
Subcontractor is responsible for field verifying all measurements prior to fabrication and Installation.
017: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for the layout. Said layout shall conform to those physical dimensions as shown on the plan.
018: 
Subcontractor shall fit and shop-assemble items in largest practical sections, for delivery to site.
019: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate items with joints tightly fitted and secured.
020: 
Subcontractor shall grind exposed joints flush and smooth with adjacent finish surface. Ease exposed edges to small uniform radius.
021: 
Exposed Mechanical Fastenings: Flush countersunk screws or bolts; unobtrusively located; consistent with design of component, except where specifically noted otherwise.
022: 
Subcontractor shall supply components required for anchorage of fabrications. Fabricate anchors and related components of same material and finish as fabrication, except where specifically noted otherwise.
023: 
Subcontractor shall clean and strip primed steel items to bare metal where site welding is required in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
024: 
Subcontractor shall install items plumb and level, accurately fitted, free from distortion or defects.
025: 
Subcontractor shall provide for erection loads, and for sufficient temporary bracing to maintain true alignment until completion of erection and installation of permanent attachments.
026: 
Subcontractor shall field weld all components as indicated on Drawings.
027: 
Subcontractor to perform field welding in accordance with AWS D1.1. Please send AWS D1.1 for review.
028: 
Subcontractor to obtain approval prior to site cutting or making adjustments not scheduled or indicated on drawings.
029: 
Subcontractor shall, after erection, prime welds, abrasions, and surfaces not shop primed, except surfaces to be in contact with concrete.
030: 
Subcontractor shall ensure all welding procedures  are followed  for all material as required as a part of the contract.
031: 
Subcontractor shall clean surfaces of rust, scale, grease, and foreign matter prior to finishing.
032: 
Subcontractor shall NOT prime surfaces in direct contact with concrete or where field welding is required.
033: 
Subcontractor shall treat all ornamental iron per specifications. 
034: 
Subcontractor shall prime non-structural items with one coat Red oxide primer or equal.
035: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade.
036: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractor's Superintendent.
037: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for the cost of replacement by others.  
038: 
Subcontractor to Supply FOB elevator hoist beams and plates for each building per detail 20/SD3.
039: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.

Company Name:Cobalt Engineering Co


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:Cobalt Engineering Co

Trade:Dry Utilities

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Subcontractors shall work at jobsite Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. (if required by general contractor to maintain the construction schedule).  No additional costs for overtime or premium time shall be allowed or accepted.
002: 
Ownership is seeking LEED Compliance on this project.  Refer to LEED NC Version 2.2 Checklist information on Sheets A00.00 for any items that may pertain to your specific trade.  All accociated LEED costs are included in this subcontract agreement.
003: 
This is a “Prevailing Wage” Project. Subcontractor has fully explored the requirements of this project and has included all labor costs associated with those findings. Labor Costs shall include but are not limited to, hourly rates, vacation rates, apprentice training programs, penalties assessed for improper record keeping, etc.
004: 
Subcontractor shall maintain "As Built" drawings throughout the course of construction. These plans shall be available for review on the site and delivered to the contractor at the "Close Out" of the project.
005: 
It is hereby understood that the structures covered herein are to be built as shown on the approved plans and this scope of work, any variations or discrepancies noted shall be immediately brought to the attention of Contractor's Representative and resolved. No deviations regarding the design or structural integrity of the building are acceptable. 
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control required for this scope of work.
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all traffic plates as required to provide pedestrian and vehicle access over exposed and open trenches for the duration of the work.
008: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all dust control for the total duration of this scope of work in accordance with all agencies having jurisdiction.
009: 
Subcontractor has included all mobilzations required to complete this scope of work.
010: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, equipment, tools and materials necessary to layout and sawcut existing concrete paving, remove concrete paving spoils and haul off site.
011: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, equipment, tools and materials necessary to layout, sawcut existing concrete, demolish the existing utility vault, remove concrete debris and spoils off site.
012: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and materials to excavate and prepare for the installation of new Edison electrical vault, to include rock sub-base, conduit installations, slurry backfill and all other items to provide for a complete installation in  accordance with plans, specifications, Southern California Edison and all agencies having jurisdictions.
013: 
Trenches to be clean with angular bottoms.  Edison and or Soils engineer to approve trench bottom prior to covering.  Subcontractor shall include shading of pipe (if required) by soils engineer or any agencies having jurisdiction. 
014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all equipment and labor for excavation and backfill as required for the installation of all conduits and vents.  Backfill shall be concrete slurry in accordance with Southern California Edison requirements and all agencies having jurisdiction.
015: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all conduits and vents for a complete system in accordance with plans, specifications, Edison plan and all agencies having jurisdiction.
016: 
Subcontractor shall make all connections to utilities that have been installed to within 5'-0" of the building. If utilities are not available at the time Subcontractor has completed work, then Subcontractor shall extend conduit system to within 5'-0" outside the building line or as directed by Contractor and in coordination with Edison and Civil plans.
017: 
Subcontractor shall mark using a stake or hub the location of the burried conduits or utilities for the convenience of the connecting subcontractor.
018: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install temporary pavement repair and patching at all utility trenches for the purpose of providing an all weather driving surface until the permanate alley construction starts.
019: 
Subcontractor shall provide skilled labor to support Southern California Edison during installation.
020: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
021: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent. 
022: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.

Company Name:Rockwell Drywall, Inc.


ProjectName: Coventry Court - Tustin ProjectID = 41

Subcontractor:Rockwell Drywall, Inc.

Trade:Drywall

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Subcontractors shall work at jobsite Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (if required by general contractor).  No costs for overtime or premium time shall be accepted.
002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools, equipment and facilities to provide complete drywall and steel stud work at buildings no. 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9,10, Club House and Pool House including CMU walls and columns in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and all agencies having jurisdiction.  CMU to receive brown and color coat only.
003: 
Subcontractor acknowledges this is a Type V rated building. It is the responsibility of the Subcontractor to supply and install the correct thickness and type of drywall necessary at all fire rated walls and assemblies.  All wall and shaft types, or ratings, are to be a part of this contract, even if not expressly noted on plans. Subcontractor shall facilitate the proper construction techniques to complete all fire rated assembles built upon or around Subcontractor's work.
004: 
Subcontractor shall obtain authorization from jobsite superintendent prior to the removal of any other trades work during the stocking of drywall and shall be fully responsible for all the associated work necessary to re-install what was removed
005: 
Subcontractor is fully aware of the SWPPP requirements regarding contamination to the soils around each building from their operations and shall be responsible for any violations resulting in the performance of the WORK.  Any removal or damage to existing  SWPPP protections in-place on the Project by the Subcontractor during the performance of the WORK will be the responsibility of the Subcontractor.
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all drywall draft stop, draft stops at mansard roof areas and rated partitions for fire assemblies as needed in accordance with plans, specifications state and local codes, indusrty standards and all agencies having jurisdiction. 
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install 5/8" type X gypsum board typical throughout, unless noted otherwise.
008: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install proprietary wallboard systems per plans and specifications. Where proprietary assemblies are to be used or called out for in the specifications, subcontractor is to use exact board materials, screws, etc., as required to meet those assembly requirements.  Substitutions will be allowed only with both Architect and Building and Safety approval.
009: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install fire rated acoustical caulking at all unit perimeter walls in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install either "bullnose" or "standard" cornerbead as selected by owner. All cornerbead shall be metal and installed plumb by the use of nails, screws or staples in accordance with industry standards.  Windows and back of closets shall receive standard cornerbead.
011: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install rated shaft wall systems for stairs, trash chutes, elevator MEP shafts, etc.  For stair and stair platform sections and per plans and specifications.
012: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install assemblies that meet the acoustical requirements as defined by the Title 24 reports, acoustical engineer, plans and specifications. 
013: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install metal stud soffits in kitchen, hallways, living room, laundry room, closets, bathrooms and bedrooms as needed in accordance with the plans and specifications.
014: 
Subcontractor shall construct all metal stud framing, soffits, drops, lids, walls, partitions, shafts, etc. using the construction methods detailed in the approved plans. 
015: 
Subcontractor shall supply and install all metal stud framed soffits for ductwork and HVAC units in accordance with the specifications and in coordinated with Mechanical Subcontractors required layout and schedule. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install preliminary drywall at all bath tubs, fire rated spaces, elevators, trash chute, recessed lights, fresh air duct, bath exhaust, kitchen exhaust, laundry exhaust, plumbing or mechanical bays or shafts, electrical panels, ice maker box, tub traps, corridor ceilings and all other areas as required by state and local codes,  plans, specifications, Contractors's Superintendent's direction and all agencies having jurisdiction.  All fire taping of all preliminary drywall per the plans, specifications, and all agencies having jurisdiction.
017: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all exterior drywall in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and all agencies having jurisdiction.  Subcontractor shall have use of scaffolding to epedite the exterior drywall installation (scaffolding by others). 
018: 
Subcontractor shall drywall mud all gaps between the HVAC Metal Registers and  Fan Coil Units to provide a tight seal in accordance with LEED equivelency Requirements.
019: 
Subcontractor shall not stock any drywall that covers work or blocks the work of others.  Should Subcontractor's materials block access to others from their required work this Subcontractor will move and restack his materials as a part of this contract. 
020: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and equipment to stock drywall and drywall materials throughout the project as directed by superintendent.  Drywall production of the type V wood framing areas shall comence at the 1st floor and continue to the roof, subcontractor has included all costs associated with this operation.
021: 
if required, subcontractor shall provide temporary shoring for all stocked drywall stacks in accordance with industry standards.  Subcontractor has included all labor to patch, tape, texture and finish all patched areas due to this operation.  Patches shall be seamless and blend with the production drywall operation.
022: 
Subcontractor shall not stock any drywall that blocks halls, corridors or emergency egress Should Subcontractor's materials block access or egress, Subcontractor will move and restack his materials as a part of this contract. 
023: 
Subcontractor shall protect drywall stacks, if required to do so from Inclement weather.
024: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for stocking of all drywall materials in locations as directed by the Contractors Superintendent. 
025: 
Subcontractor acknowledges that the drywall production operation (installation) of the type V wood framing areas shall comence at the 1st wood framing level and continue to the roof, subcontractor has included all costs associated with this operation.
026: 
Subcontractor shall take care not to damage the work of others.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for any and all damage performed by his trade to the work of others.  
027: 
Subcontractor shall mark stud walls and ceiling for "out of plumb" or "out of plane" conditions that may impact drywall finish prior to installation. Subcontractor shall not cover substandard work or conditions.
028: 
Subcontractor shall attach drywall by nailing the perimeter and screwing the field in acorrdance with industry standards, state and local codes, plans, specifications and in accordance with all agencies having jurisdiction.
029: 
Subcontractor shall install all drywall true, flat, and free of bumps, waves, or bulges.  All joints shall be taped, filled with gypsum joint compound until all joints are smooth, feathered and free of defects in accordance with industry standards.
030: 
Subcontractor shall neatly fill with a suitable material all gaps or areas where gypsum board contacts adjacent surfaces including, but not limited to, window and door frames, stucco metals, under granite counters and other surfaces that abut or adjoin drywall.
031: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all drywall accessories to include; RC 1 & 2 Channels, L Metals, Hat Channels, RSIC-Clips and all other drywall accessories to provide a complete drywall system in accordance with plans, specifications, industry standards, state and local codes and all agencies having jurisdiction.
032: 
Subcontractor shall attach drywall to RC channel being careful not to screw the channel into the wood members supporting the channel. Note: Colored screws can help the inspection agencies insure that the proper attachment is achieved
033: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install over drywall Hamiltons Prep-Coat or approved equal at all common areas, this is to reduce "highlighting" of taped joints after painting. 
034: 
Subcontractor shall furnish for approval by owner and contractor samples of wall and ceiling texture finish prior to the texture operations .  The level for the drywall finish shall be three (3), medium orange peel texture at walls and ceilings. 
035: 
Subcontractor shall pick up, remove, load and haul off site ("scrap-out") all unused drywall after the preliminary drywall operation.  Subcontractor shall provide all recycle certificates to General Contractor in accordance with the City of San Diego requirements.
036: 
Subcontractor shall pick up, remove, load and haul off site ("scrap-out") all unused drywall after the production drywall hanging operation.  Subcontractor shall provide all recycle certificates to General Contractor in accordance with the City of San Diego requirements.
037: 
Subcontractor shall provide labor to scrape, sweep, pick up and haul off (industrial clean) all debris after the drywall texturing operation.
038: 
After completion of drywall operations, Subcontractor shall perform a walkthrough with Project Superintendent and a representative from the painting company.  All three parties must agree that the gypsum board is "ready for paint".  Any defects in the gypsum board as noted in this walkthrough must be corrected immediately to the satisfaction of the Project Superintendent and painting representative.
039: 
Subcontractor shall funish labor and material to provide 1st "pick-up" walk through and repairs after texturing operation
040: 
Subcontractor shall furnish labor and material to provide 2nd "pick-up" walk through and repairs after finish carpentry and cabinet installation.
041: 
Subcontractor shall furnish labor and material to provide 3rd "pick-up" walk through and repairs after hard surface flooring installation.
042: 
Subcontractor shall provide for a final walk through with the onsite superintendent for the purpose of "accepting " the final drywall for quality control.  Subcontractor shall be responsible for creating and implementing their internal final punch list of repairs.  Once the punch list work is completed, the Project Superintendent shall walk through project to inspect drywall for acceptance.
043: 
Subcontractor agrees to fix minor repairs, but excessive repairs will be charged back to the appropriate subcontractors.
044: 
Subcontractor agrees to replace all mold infected drywall as a part of the contract, but excessive mold repairs (more than 20 square feet per occurrence) caused by water damage shall be charged back to the appropriate subcontractors if applicable.

Company Name:Mark Company


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Mark Company

Trade:A/C Paving

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Overtime pay must be approved in writing by the Construction Manager prior to work being performed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install labor, materials, tools, equipment and facilities to furnish and install all 3.5" AC Paving over 8" aggregate base any other items necessary  to complete the scope of work.  Subcontractor to return to furnish and install a 2" AC cap.  3 Move ins are included for 3.5" AC over Base and 1 move in for AC Cap.  Bid is based on soils report dated 7/25/06 and supplemented pavement section recommendations by Southwest Inspections $ Testing dated 7/16/11.
003: 
Subcontractor understands that curb & gutter and CTB at paver locations will be installed by others.  Subcontracotr will install up to curb & gutter and pave thorugh CTB at paver sections with 3 1/2" AC, No cap.
004: 
Subcontractor shall receive all grades at plus or minus .10' from Contractor. Subcontractor to cooridinate with the Grading Subcontractor.  Excludes any import or export of soil.  Alternate pricing provided to regrade from .5'.
005: 
Paving areas must have adequate slope as to appease all drainage and the City of San Diego requirements per plans and specifications.
006: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all clean up and removal of debris after completion of his work.
007: 
Subcontractor shall provide flagmen for any trucking operations as required.  Traffic controls systems or permits are by others.
008: 
Subcontractor shall repair or replace and erosion control materials damaged by their work.  Set up of erosion control items are by others.
009: 
Pricing is a lump sum, fixed price per plans and specifications.  Prices are good through 12/31/2011.  If work is not schedule prior to this date, 30 days advance notice shall be provided by the Subcontractor if there are any changes .  If notice is not provided the contract price will not be increased.  
010: 
Subcontractor has provided for 2" AC cap including light wash and tack coat at AC areas.
011: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
012: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent.

Company Name:National Demolition


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:National Demolition

Trade:Abatement & Demolition

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m (if required by General Contractor  required to maintain construction schedule).  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide notification to the SCAQMD and all other agencies having jurisdiction of the abatement of the structures.  Subcontractor shall procure and pay for all permits for this work.
003: 
Subcontractor shall handle, transport and dispose of all hazardous materils in accordance with federal, state and local regulations to an EPA approved landfill.
004: 
Subcontractor shall remove and legally dispose of all asbestos and lead containing materials in accordance with Anderson Enviromental survey report dated 6/2/2010.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and material to provide containment of asbestos and lead to the work areas and provide air samples in accordance with all state and local agencies having jurisdiction.
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install sidewalk pedestrian protection canopy during the course of the demolition work.  
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools and equipment to perform the demolition of the existing structures and haul off all debris to an approved landfill in accordance with plans by Studio One Eleven dated 9/28/2010 and jobsite visit of the project site to include but not limited to the following;  building structures and foundations complete,  asphalt, concrete, drain grates, iron fences and gates, planter walls and footings, guard posts, trash enclouser, trees and shrubs, misc vegetation, and all other misc items to provide a commplete demolition.
008: 
Upon completion the project site shall be left in a clean and level condition.
009: 
Subcontractor shall cap all existing sewer laterals in accordance with state and local codes, city of Long Beach and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall saw cut all concrete and asphalt as required to provide a acceptable trasition to the new construction.
011: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
012: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
013: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
014: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
015: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide closeout documentation to General Contractor at completion of all abatement and demolition work.

Company Name:Secure Sheet Metal


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Secure Sheet Metal

Trade:Aluminum Siding & Sheet Metal

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific:
0001: 
Subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract unless specifically stated above. It is agreed and understood that this is a lump sum contract and that there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs and without a fully executed change order.
0002: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all Structural and Architectural drawings and is responsible for all Sheet Metal per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.
0003: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with all other trades to accomplish all preliminary operations including embed sheet metal (reglets, dado, etc) items for the masonry subcontractor or other trades as needed or indicated on plans. 
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all sheet metal trade work, including but not limited to the following:
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Roof Areas
Coping
Mechanical Platform Covers
Elevator Vents
Trash Chute Covers
Roof Threshold Flashings
Deck Fla+shing
Balcony Deck Flashing
Roof Scuppers
Roof Overflow Scuppers
Balcony Scuppers
Downspouts
Threshold Flashings at Doors
Threshold Flashings at Sliding Glass Doors
Podium Deck Flashing
Leader Heads
Deck Edge Flashing
Storefront Sill Flashing
Curtain Wall Head Flashing
Bath Vents
Boiler Covers
AC Covers
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Grade Levels
Fascia at Pitched Roofs
Fascia at Horizontal Projections
Break Metal at Windows
Fascia with Built In Gutter
Window Head Flashing
Garage Vent Louvers
Metal Siding "Opaline"
Cricket Flashing
Break Metal at Fire Sprinkler Head Enclosures
Fascia at Corridor and Deck Railings
Podium to Framing Flashing
0005: 
Subcontractor shall layout and mark all vent shafts and roof penetrations for the rough carpentry subcontractor. All dimensions are to be calculated as stud to stud. (Cutting of wood members by others).
0006: 
Subcontractor shall mark all vent shafts to receive drywall in bright marking paint prior to preliminary drywall work.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall insure that all roof penetrations and terminations are complete before any roofing begins. 
0008: 
Subcontractor shall install work with laps, joints and seams which will be permanently water tight and weatherproof.
0100: 
Materials:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all fasteners, solder, mastic sealants flashing compound, roofing cement, electrometric sealants as part of this contract.  All sealants, mastics and solders are to meet current SMACNA's Architectural Sheet Metal Manual standards. 
0102: 
Subcontractor agrees to ensure compatibility with all surrounding materials for each product used.  Material product data sheets must be delivered to project superintendent prior the each materials use on project.  
0103: 
Galvanized steel to be commercial quality carbon complying with ASTM A 755/A 755M. The Zinc coated process shall be per ASTM 653A/653M.
0104: 
Provide 24 gage minimum unless a heavier gage is noted on plans or code requirements for the use specified.
0105: 
If materials are shown as pre finished in color, all finishes shall be factory baked enamel unless noted otherwise on plans. All finish colors will be selected by owner/ architect. 
0106: 
Copings and Parapet caps shall be installed using no exposed fasteners.  Use clip and cleat method of fasteners.   Ensure that no water will pond on surface and there is a positive drainage to roof areas, so that no drip marks will stain the stucco or wall faces. 
0107: 
Subcontractor agrees to conceal all fasteners where possible, use same metal as flashing/sheet metal or other corrosion resistant metal as recommended by manufacturer, match finish of exposed heads with material being fastened.
0200: 
Safety
0201: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Trench forms and Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the depth of the Subcontractor's work is greater than allowed. 
0202: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor's work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work 
0203: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor's work requires Safety Protection.
0204: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor's scope of work. 
0205: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor's weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0206: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor's representative or CALOSHA. 
0207: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0208: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor's work (if required) 
0300: 
Pickup
0301: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
0302: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractor's Superintendent.
0303: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for that cost if replaced by others.   
0304: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0400: 
Cleanup
0401: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor's containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0402: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor's waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel and sweep clean these areas and paths nightly. 
0403: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove all trash generated by their finish installation crews on finish their operations.
0404: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0405: 
All miscellaneous debris will be taken to containers or piled in areas designated by the Contractor's Superintendent.

Company Name:General Electric


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:General Electric

Trade:Appliances

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
OPERATIONS
002: 
1.    Subcontractor shall include all taxes, delivery, spreading to individual units, and complete installation costs for all necessary appliances. 
003: 
2.    Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer’s paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
004: 
3.    Refrigerators shall include all parts and hook up to manufacturers plumbing, electrical and cabinetry specifications and water lines from house supply shall be cleared of all debris prior to connection to refrigerator. 
005: 
4.    Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately two (2) weeks. 
006: 
DELIVERY
007: 
5.    There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
008: 
6.    All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day.
009: 
7.    All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
010: 
8.    Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
011: 
INSTALLATION
012: 
9.    Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.
013: 
10.  Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.
014: 
11.  Subcontractor agrees to coordinate his work with associated trades and shall notify Contractor’s Superintendent or representative any corrections necessary in order to complete the work outlined in this contract.
015: 
12.  Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
016: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
017: 
13.  In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor’s Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
018: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS
019: 
Electric range: Front controls & std clean: JBS13 x 46
020: 
Range hood: 30” hood, non-vented: JN327 x 46
021: 
Refrigerator: 18.0 cu ft, top-freezer, glass shelves, energy star: GTH18JB x 46
022: 
Dishwasher: 5 Cycle, 3 options, power scrub, energy star: GSD3300 x 46
023: 
PLAN CHANGES AND CLARIFICATIONS
024: 
14.  The specifications outlined in the “Project Specification Book” and or “Project Manual,” shall take precedence over specifications outlined in this scope of work unless otherwise stated below.  The Project Specification Book shall be considered a part of the Contract Agreement and it is Subcontractor’s responsibility to clarify discrepancies with Contractor’s Purchasing Department prior to award of contract.  Subcontractor is to review said document for other trades product specification which may affect his work.
025: 
a.    EXCLUDED – Coil operated washers and dryers by others.
026: 
PICK-UP
027: 
15.  Perform all corrective work necessary to provide a finished product that meets the Contractor’s standards.  Pick-up work will be completed with in seventy-two (72) hours of installation.
028: 
16.  All damaged material will be replaced immediately.
029: 
17.  Subcontractor shall have all pick-up work completed prior to Owner walk-thru.
030: 
WARRANTY INFORMATION
031: 
18.  All warranties for labor and materials, complete, shall be two (2) years from date of install.

Company Name:Robert Lunetta Co


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Robert Lunetta Co

Trade:Balcony Railings, Vehicle Gates, & Decorative Fencing

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific
0001: 
The subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract, unless otherwise specifically stated above. It is also agreed and understood that this is a Not To Exceed Contract and there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs. In the event there is a major change in the subcontractor's scope of work a change order will be issued by Cobalt Construction.  
0002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, material, tools, equipment and supplies as necessary to complete the Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates work in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction. All Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates shall be constructed plumb and true, square and properly fitted in accordance with the drawings and shall consist of, but not be limited to, all necessary materials including screws, bolts, brackets, and all other miscellaneous items not specifically mentioned hereinafter.
0003: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all plans specified in the contract and is responsible for all Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for verifying with Contractor’s Superintendent that he has all the latest contract documents, plans and specifications prepared and approved for construction.
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all work as indicated on the approved plans and any variations or discrepancies noted shall be immediately brought to the attention of Contractor's Representative and resolved. No deviations regarding the design or structural integrity of the building are acceptable. 
0005: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Balcony Rails, Parapet Guard Rails and Balcony Privacy Screens per plans and specifications. Balcony rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0006: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Podium Deck, Corridor, and Roof Guard Rails per plans and specifications. Guard Rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Entry Stoop Stair Rails and Guard Rails per plans and specifications. Entry Stoop Guard Rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0008: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Steel Roof Ladders and Elevator Pit Ladders per plans and specifications. 
0009: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Bollards per plans and specifications. 
0010: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Garage Fencing and Automatic Vehicle Gates per plans and specifications. Vehicle Gates shall include motors, installation of safety loops, and (50) remotes per plans and specifications.
0011: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Site Fencing and Pedestrian Gates per plans and specifications.
0012: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Patio Fencing and Gates per plans and specifications.
0013: 
Subcontractor agrees to supply shop drawings with submittals; Submit shop drawings for structural steel, steel and stairs and rails prior to fabrication and installation.
0014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish to job site superintendent all material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) literature for all materials prior to delivery of any materials.
0100: 
Shop Drawings:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall indicate all shop and erection details including cuts, penetrations for pipes and ducts, profiles, sizes, spacing, locations of structural members, openings, attachments, fasteners, and welds.
0102: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for Steel Stairs under direct supervision of and signed and sealed by a California-licensed Structural Engineer experienced in design of this work.
0103: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for submittal to the Engineer of Record for approval per structural note 12/S1.0.
0104: 
Subcontractor shall identify all welded connections, both shop and field, with AWS A 2.4 welding symbols for welding and Non-Destructive Testing.
0105: 
Subcontractor shall sbmit manufacturer’s mill certificates and mill test report for all structural steel to be used in the work.
0106: 
Subcontractor shall certify all welders employed on the Work, verifying AWS qualification within the previous 12 months in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
0107: 
For metal stairs include pans, elevations, sections, details, and attachments to other work. Provide templates for anchors and bolts specified for installation under other Sections.
0200: 
Examination
0201: 
Subcontractor is responsible for field verifying all measurements prior to fabrication and Installation.
0202: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for the layout. Said layout shall conform to those physical dimensions as shown on the plan.
0300: 
Fabrication
0301: 
Subcontractor shall fit and shop-assemble items in largest practical sections, for delivery to site.
0302: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate items with joints tightly fitted and secured.
0303: 
Subcontractor shall grind exposed joints flush and smooth with adjacent finish surface. Ease exposed edges to small uniform radius.
0304: 
Exposed Mechanical Fastenings: Flush countersunk screws or bolts; unobtrusively located; consistent with design of component, except where specifically noted otherwise.
0305: 
Subcontractor shall supply components required for anchorage of fabrications. Fabricate anchors and related components of same material and finish as fabrication, except where specifically noted otherwise.
0400: 
Preparation
0401: 
Subcontractor shall clean and strip primed steel items to bare metal where site welding is required in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
0500: 
Installation
0501: 
Subcontractor shall install items plumb and level, accurately fitted, free from distortion or defects.
0502: 
Subcontractor shall provide for erection loads, and for sufficient temporary bracing to maintain true alignment until completion of erection and installation of permanent attachments.
0503: 
Subcontractor shall field weld all components as indicated on Drawings.
0504: 
Subcontractor to perform field welding in accordance with AWS D1.1. Please send AWS D1.1 for review.
0505: 
Subcontractor to obtain approval prior to site cutting or making adjustments not scheduled or indicated on drawings.
0506: 
Subcontractor shall, after erection, prime welds, abrasions, and surfaces not shop primed, except surfaces to be in contact with concrete.
0507: 
Subcontractor shall ensure all welding procedures  are followed  for all material as required as a part of the contract.
0600: 
Finishes - steel
0601: 
Subcontractor shall clean surfaces of rust, scale, grease, and foreign matter prior to finishing.
0602: 
Subcontractor shall NOT prime surfaces in direct contact with concrete or where field welding is required.
0603: 
Subcontractor shall prime all ornamental iron with one coat Red oxide primer or equal (per specification manual) at exposed surfaces and two coats at all surfaces that will be inaccessible  after installation.
0700: 
Safety
0701: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor’s work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work
0702: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor’s work requires Safety Protection.
0703: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor’s scope of work.
0704: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor’s weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0705: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all  tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor’s  representative or CALOSHA.
0706: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0707: 
Subcontractor shall only perform welding within easy reach of a fully charged fire extinguisher. One 10 pound capacity ABC rated fire extinguisher for each torch / welder at all times.
0708: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor’s work (if required).
0800: 
Pickup
0801: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade.
0802: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors  Superintendent.
0803: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for the cost of replacement by others.  
0804: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0900: 
Cleanup
0901: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor’s containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0902: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor’s waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel. 
0903: 
Subcontractor shall sweep clean corridors, halls and paths of travel of any debris generated by their operations on a nightly basis.
0904: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove to Contractor's containers all trash generated by their finish installation crews on completion of their operations.
0905: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0906:

Company Name:Mark Company


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Mark Company

Trade:A/C Paving

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Overtime pay must be approved in writing by the Construction Manager prior to work being performed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install labor, materials, tools, equipment and facilities to furnish and install all 3.5" AC Paving over 8" aggregate base any other items necessary  to complete the scope of work.  Subcontractor to return to furnish and install a 2" AC cap.  3 Move ins are included for 3.5" AC over Base and 1 move in for AC Cap.  Bid is based on soils report dated 7/25/06 and supplemented pavement section recommendations by Southwest Inspections $ Testing dated 7/16/11.
003: 
Subcontractor understands that curb & gutter and CTB at paver locations will be installed by others.  Subcontracotr will install up to curb & gutter and pave thorugh CTB at paver sections with 3 1/2" AC, No cap.
004: 
Subcontractor shall receive all grades at plus or minus .10' from Contractor. Subcontractor to cooridinate with the Grading Subcontractor.  Excludes any import or export of soil.  Alternate pricing provided to regrade from .5'.
005: 
Paving areas must have adequate slope as to appease all drainage and the City of San Diego requirements per plans and specifications.
006: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all clean up and removal of debris after completion of his work.
007: 
Subcontractor shall provide flagmen for any trucking operations as required.  Traffic controls systems or permits are by others.
008: 
Subcontractor shall repair or replace and erosion control materials damaged by their work.  Set up of erosion control items are by others.
009: 
Pricing is a lump sum, fixed price per plans and specifications.  Prices are good through 12/31/2011.  If work is not schedule prior to this date, 30 days advance notice shall be provided by the Subcontractor if there are any changes .  If notice is not provided the contract price will not be increased.  
010: 
Subcontractor has provided for 2" AC cap including light wash and tack coat at AC areas.
011: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
012: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent.

Company Name:National Demolition


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:National Demolition

Trade:Abatement & Demolition

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m (if required by General Contractor  required to maintain construction schedule).  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide notification to the SCAQMD and all other agencies having jurisdiction of the abatement of the structures.  Subcontractor shall procure and pay for all permits for this work.
003: 
Subcontractor shall handle, transport and dispose of all hazardous materils in accordance with federal, state and local regulations to an EPA approved landfill.
004: 
Subcontractor shall remove and legally dispose of all asbestos and lead containing materials in accordance with Anderson Enviromental survey report dated 6/2/2010.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and material to provide containment of asbestos and lead to the work areas and provide air samples in accordance with all state and local agencies having jurisdiction.
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install sidewalk pedestrian protection canopy during the course of the demolition work.  
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools and equipment to perform the demolition of the existing structures and haul off all debris to an approved landfill in accordance with plans by Studio One Eleven dated 9/28/2010 and jobsite visit of the project site to include but not limited to the following;  building structures and foundations complete,  asphalt, concrete, drain grates, iron fences and gates, planter walls and footings, guard posts, trash enclouser, trees and shrubs, misc vegetation, and all other misc items to provide a commplete demolition.
008: 
Upon completion the project site shall be left in a clean and level condition.
009: 
Subcontractor shall cap all existing sewer laterals in accordance with state and local codes, city of Long Beach and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall saw cut all concrete and asphalt as required to provide a acceptable trasition to the new construction.
011: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
012: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
013: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
014: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
015: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide closeout documentation to General Contractor at completion of all abatement and demolition work.

Exclusions

Company Name:Secure Sheet Metal


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Secure Sheet Metal

Trade:Aluminum Siding & Sheet Metal

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific:
0001: 
Subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract unless specifically stated above. It is agreed and understood that this is a lump sum contract and that there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs and without a fully executed change order.
0002: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all Structural and Architectural drawings and is responsible for all Sheet Metal per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.
0003: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with all other trades to accomplish all preliminary operations including embed sheet metal (reglets, dado, etc) items for the masonry subcontractor or other trades as needed or indicated on plans. 
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all sheet metal trade work, including but not limited to the following:
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Roof Areas
Coping
Mechanical Platform Covers
Elevator Vents
Trash Chute Covers
Roof Threshold Flashings
Deck Fla+shing
Balcony Deck Flashing
Roof Scuppers
Roof Overflow Scuppers
Balcony Scuppers
Downspouts
Threshold Flashings at Doors
Threshold Flashings at Sliding Glass Doors
Podium Deck Flashing
Leader Heads
Deck Edge Flashing
Storefront Sill Flashing
Curtain Wall Head Flashing
Bath Vents
Boiler Covers
AC Covers
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Grade Levels
Fascia at Pitched Roofs
Fascia at Horizontal Projections
Break Metal at Windows
Fascia with Built In Gutter
Window Head Flashing
Garage Vent Louvers
Metal Siding "Opaline"
Cricket Flashing
Break Metal at Fire Sprinkler Head Enclosures
Fascia at Corridor and Deck Railings
Podium to Framing Flashing
0005: 
Subcontractor shall layout and mark all vent shafts and roof penetrations for the rough carpentry subcontractor. All dimensions are to be calculated as stud to stud. (Cutting of wood members by others).
0006: 
Subcontractor shall mark all vent shafts to receive drywall in bright marking paint prior to preliminary drywall work.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall insure that all roof penetrations and terminations are complete before any roofing begins. 
0008: 
Subcontractor shall install work with laps, joints and seams which will be permanently water tight and weatherproof.
0100: 
Materials:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all fasteners, solder, mastic sealants flashing compound, roofing cement, electrometric sealants as part of this contract.  All sealants, mastics and solders are to meet current SMACNA's Architectural Sheet Metal Manual standards. 
0102: 
Subcontractor agrees to ensure compatibility with all surrounding materials for each product used.  Material product data sheets must be delivered to project superintendent prior the each materials use on project.  
0103: 
Galvanized steel to be commercial quality carbon complying with ASTM A 755/A 755M. The Zinc coated process shall be per ASTM 653A/653M.
0104: 
Provide 24 gage minimum unless a heavier gage is noted on plans or code requirements for the use specified.
0105: 
If materials are shown as pre finished in color, all finishes shall be factory baked enamel unless noted otherwise on plans. All finish colors will be selected by owner/ architect. 
0106: 
Copings and Parapet caps shall be installed using no exposed fasteners.  Use clip and cleat method of fasteners.   Ensure that no water will pond on surface and there is a positive drainage to roof areas, so that no drip marks will stain the stucco or wall faces. 
0107: 
Subcontractor agrees to conceal all fasteners where possible, use same metal as flashing/sheet metal or other corrosion resistant metal as recommended by manufacturer, match finish of exposed heads with material being fastened.
0200: 
Safety
0201: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Trench forms and Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the depth of the Subcontractor's work is greater than allowed. 
0202: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor's work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work 
0203: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor's work requires Safety Protection.
0204: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor's scope of work. 
0205: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor's weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0206: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor's representative or CALOSHA. 
0207: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0208: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor's work (if required) 
0300: 
Pickup
0301: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
0302: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractor's Superintendent.
0303: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for that cost if replaced by others.   
0304: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0400: 
Cleanup
0401: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor's containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0402: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor's waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel and sweep clean these areas and paths nightly. 
0403: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove all trash generated by their finish installation crews on finish their operations.
0404: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0405: 
All miscellaneous debris will be taken to containers or piled in areas designated by the Contractor's Superintendent.

Company Name:General Electric


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:General Electric

Trade:Appliances

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
OPERATIONS
002: 
1.    Subcontractor shall include all taxes, delivery, spreading to individual units, and complete installation costs for all necessary appliances. 
003: 
2.    Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer’s paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
004: 
3.    Refrigerators shall include all parts and hook up to manufacturers plumbing, electrical and cabinetry specifications and water lines from house supply shall be cleared of all debris prior to connection to refrigerator. 
005: 
4.    Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately two (2) weeks. 
006: 
DELIVERY
007: 
5.    There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
008: 
6.    All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day.
009: 
7.    All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
010: 
8.    Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
011: 
INSTALLATION
012: 
9.    Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.
013: 
10.  Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.
014: 
11.  Subcontractor agrees to coordinate his work with associated trades and shall notify Contractor’s Superintendent or representative any corrections necessary in order to complete the work outlined in this contract.
015: 
12.  Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
016: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
017: 
13.  In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor’s Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
018: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS
019: 
Electric range: Front controls & std clean: JBS13 x 46
020: 
Range hood: 30” hood, non-vented: JN327 x 46
021: 
Refrigerator: 18.0 cu ft, top-freezer, glass shelves, energy star: GTH18JB x 46
022: 
Dishwasher: 5 Cycle, 3 options, power scrub, energy star: GSD3300 x 46
023: 
PLAN CHANGES AND CLARIFICATIONS
024: 
14.  The specifications outlined in the “Project Specification Book” and or “Project Manual,” shall take precedence over specifications outlined in this scope of work unless otherwise stated below.  The Project Specification Book shall be considered a part of the Contract Agreement and it is Subcontractor’s responsibility to clarify discrepancies with Contractor’s Purchasing Department prior to award of contract.  Subcontractor is to review said document for other trades product specification which may affect his work.
025: 
a.    EXCLUDED – Coil operated washers and dryers by others.
026: 
PICK-UP
027: 
15.  Perform all corrective work necessary to provide a finished product that meets the Contractor’s standards.  Pick-up work will be completed with in seventy-two (72) hours of installation.
028: 
16.  All damaged material will be replaced immediately.
029: 
17.  Subcontractor shall have all pick-up work completed prior to Owner walk-thru.
030: 
WARRANTY INFORMATION
031: 
18.  All warranties for labor and materials, complete, shall be two (2) years from date of install.

003:

004: 
DELIVERY & SPREADING
005: 
There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
006: 
All deliveries and storage of materials shall be approved and coordinated by the Project Superintendent.
007: 
Subcontractor shall deliver, spread, and uncrate all appliances.
008: 
All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day. All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
009: 
Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
010: 
In the process of distribution of materials, Subcontractor shall not store or stack his materials in any manner that may hinder or increase the work of any other subcontractor.
011: 
Subcontractor acknowledges that a manlift or elevator may not be accessible or operational at the time of delivery and appliances may have to be transported via the stairwell.  
012:

013:

014:

015: 
Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.  
016:

017: 
Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
018: 
PROTECTION OF ADJACENT SURFACES
019:
