________________________________





Company Name:Robert Lunetta Co


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Robert Lunetta Co

Trade:Balcony Railings, Vehicle Gates, & Decorative Fencing

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific
0001: 
The subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract, unless otherwise specifically stated above. It is also agreed and understood that this is a Not To Exceed Contract and there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs. In the event there is a major change in the subcontractor's scope of work a change order will be issued by Cobalt Construction.  
0002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, material, tools, equipment and supplies as necessary to complete the Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates work in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction. All Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates shall be constructed plumb and true, square and properly fitted in accordance with the drawings and shall consist of, but not be limited to, all necessary materials including screws, bolts, brackets, and all other miscellaneous items not specifically mentioned hereinafter.
0003: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all plans specified in the contract and is responsible for all Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for verifying with Contractor’s Superintendent that he has all the latest contract documents, plans and specifications prepared and approved for construction.
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all work as indicated on the approved plans and any variations or discrepancies noted shall be immediately brought to the attention of Contractor's Representative and resolved. No deviations regarding the design or structural integrity of the building are acceptable. 
0005: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Balcony Rails, Parapet Guard Rails and Balcony Privacy Screens per plans and specifications. Balcony rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0006: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Podium Deck, Corridor, and Roof Guard Rails per plans and specifications. Guard Rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Entry Stoop Stair Rails and Guard Rails per plans and specifications. Entry Stoop Guard Rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0008: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Steel Roof Ladders and Elevator Pit Ladders per plans and specifications. 
0009: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Bollards per plans and specifications. 
0010: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Garage Fencing and Automatic Vehicle Gates per plans and specifications. Vehicle Gates shall include motors, installation of safety loops, and (50) remotes per plans and specifications.
0011: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Site Fencing and Pedestrian Gates per plans and specifications.
0012: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Patio Fencing and Gates per plans and specifications.
0013: 
Subcontractor agrees to supply shop drawings with submittals; Submit shop drawings for structural steel, steel and stairs and rails prior to fabrication and installation.
0014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish to job site superintendent all material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) literature for all materials prior to delivery of any materials.
0100: 
Shop Drawings:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall indicate all shop and erection details including cuts, penetrations for pipes and ducts, profiles, sizes, spacing, locations of structural members, openings, attachments, fasteners, and welds.
0102: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for Steel Stairs under direct supervision of and signed and sealed by a California-licensed Structural Engineer experienced in design of this work.
0103: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for submittal to the Engineer of Record for approval per structural note 12/S1.0.
0104: 
Subcontractor shall identify all welded connections, both shop and field, with AWS A 2.4 welding symbols for welding and Non-Destructive Testing.
0105: 
Subcontractor shall sbmit manufacturer’s mill certificates and mill test report for all structural steel to be used in the work.
0106: 
Subcontractor shall certify all welders employed on the Work, verifying AWS qualification within the previous 12 months in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
0107: 
For metal stairs include pans, elevations, sections, details, and attachments to other work. Provide templates for anchors and bolts specified for installation under other Sections.
0200: 
Examination
0201: 
Subcontractor is responsible for field verifying all measurements prior to fabrication and Installation.
0202: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for the layout. Said layout shall conform to those physical dimensions as shown on the plan.
0300: 
Fabrication
0301: 
Subcontractor shall fit and shop-assemble items in largest practical sections, for delivery to site.
0302: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate items with joints tightly fitted and secured.
0303: 
Subcontractor shall grind exposed joints flush and smooth with adjacent finish surface. Ease exposed edges to small uniform radius.
0304: 
Exposed Mechanical Fastenings: Flush countersunk screws or bolts; unobtrusively located; consistent with design of component, except where specifically noted otherwise.
0305: 
Subcontractor shall supply components required for anchorage of fabrications. Fabricate anchors and related components of same material and finish as fabrication, except where specifically noted otherwise.
0400: 
Preparation
0401: 
Subcontractor shall clean and strip primed steel items to bare metal where site welding is required in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
0500: 
Installation
0501: 
Subcontractor shall install items plumb and level, accurately fitted, free from distortion or defects.
0502: 
Subcontractor shall provide for erection loads, and for sufficient temporary bracing to maintain true alignment until completion of erection and installation of permanent attachments.
0503: 
Subcontractor shall field weld all components as indicated on Drawings.
0504: 
Subcontractor to perform field welding in accordance with AWS D1.1. Please send AWS D1.1 for review.
0505: 
Subcontractor to obtain approval prior to site cutting or making adjustments not scheduled or indicated on drawings.
0506: 
Subcontractor shall, after erection, prime welds, abrasions, and surfaces not shop primed, except surfaces to be in contact with concrete.
0507: 
Subcontractor shall ensure all welding procedures  are followed  for all material as required as a part of the contract.
0600: 
Finishes - steel
0601: 
Subcontractor shall clean surfaces of rust, scale, grease, and foreign matter prior to finishing.
0602: 
Subcontractor shall NOT prime surfaces in direct contact with concrete or where field welding is required.
0603: 
Subcontractor shall prime all ornamental iron with one coat Red oxide primer or equal (per specification manual) at exposed surfaces and two coats at all surfaces that will be inaccessible  after installation.
0700: 
Safety
0701: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor’s work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work
0702: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor’s work requires Safety Protection.
0703: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor’s scope of work.
0704: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor’s weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0705: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all  tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor’s  representative or CALOSHA.
0706: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0707: 
Subcontractor shall only perform welding within easy reach of a fully charged fire extinguisher. One 10 pound capacity ABC rated fire extinguisher for each torch / welder at all times.
0708: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor’s work (if required).
0800: 
Pickup
0801: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade.
0802: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors  Superintendent.
0803: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for the cost of replacement by others.  
0804: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0900: 
Cleanup
0901: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor’s containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0902: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor’s waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel. 
0903: 
Subcontractor shall sweep clean corridors, halls and paths of travel of any debris generated by their operations on a nightly basis.
0904: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove to Contractor's containers all trash generated by their finish installation crews on completion of their operations.
0905: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0906: 
Subcontractor shall remove all tools, miscellaneous hardware and materials left over at the end of the their work.

003:

004:

If notice is not provided the contract price will not be increased.

Company Name:National Demolition


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:National Demolition

Trade:Abatement & Demolition

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m (if required by General Contractor  required to maintain construction schedule).  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide notification to the SCAQMD and all other agencies having jurisdiction of the abatement of the structures.  Subcontractor shall procure and pay for all permits for this work.
003: 
Subcontractor shall handle, transport and dispose of all hazardous materils in accordance with federal, state and local regulations to an EPA approved landfill.
004: 
Subcontractor shall remove and legally dispose of all asbestos and lead containing materials in accordance with Anderson Enviromental survey report dated 6/2/2010.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and material to provide containment of asbestos and lead to the work areas and provide air samples in accordance with all state and local agencies having jurisdiction.
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install sidewalk pedestrian protection canopy during the course of the demolition work.  
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools and equipment to perform the demolition of the existing structures and haul off all debris to an approved landfill in accordance with plans by Studio One Eleven dated 9/28/2010 and jobsite visit of the project site to include but not limited to the following;  building structures and foundations complete,  asphalt, concrete, drain grates, iron fences and gates, planter walls and footings, guard posts, trash enclouser, trees and shrubs, misc vegetation, and all other misc items to provide a commplete demolition.
008: 
Upon completion the project site shall be left in a clean and level condition.
009: 
Subcontractor shall cap all existing sewer laterals in accordance with state and local codes, city of Long Beach and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall saw cut all concrete and asphalt as required to provide a acceptable trasition to the new construction.
011: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
012: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
013: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
014: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
015: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide closeout documentation to General Contractor at completion of all abatement and demolition work.

Company Name:Secure Sheet Metal

Subcontractor:Secure Sheet Metal

Trade:Aluminum Siding & Sheet Metal

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific:
0001: 
Subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract unless specifically stated above. It is agreed and understood that this is a lump sum contract and that there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs and without a fully executed change order.
0002: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all Structural and Architectural drawings and is responsible for all Sheet Metal per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.
0003: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with all other trades to accomplish all preliminary operations including embed sheet metal (reglets, dado, etc) items for the masonry subcontractor or other trades as needed or indicated on plans. 
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all sheet metal trade work, including but not limited to the following:
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Roof Areas
Coping
Mechanical Platform Covers
Elevator Vents
Trash Chute Covers
Roof Threshold Flashings
Deck Fla+shing
Balcony Deck Flashing
Roof Scuppers
Roof Overflow Scuppers
Balcony Scuppers
Downspouts
Threshold Flashings at Doors
Threshold Flashings at Sliding Glass Doors
Podium Deck Flashing
Leader Heads
Deck Edge Flashing
Storefront Sill Flashing
Curtain Wall Head Flashing
Bath Vents
Boiler Covers
AC Covers

Break Metal at Windows

Garage Vent Louvers
Metal Siding "Opaline"
Cricket Flashing
Break Metal at Fire Sprinkler Head Enclosures
Fascia at Corridor and Deck Railings
Podium to Framing Flashing
0005: 
Subcontractor shall layout and mark all vent shafts and roof penetrations for the rough carpentry subcontractor. All dimensions are to be calculated as stud to stud. (Cutting of wood members by others).
0006: 
Subcontractor shall mark all vent shafts to receive drywall in bright marking paint prior to preliminary drywall work.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall insure that all roof penetrations and terminations are complete before any roofing begins. 
0008: 
Subcontractor shall install work with laps, joints and seams which will be permanently water tight and weatherproof.
0100: 
Materials:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all fasteners, solder, mastic sealants flashing compound, roofing cement, electrometric sealants as part of this contract.  All sealants, mastics and solders are to meet current SMACNA's Architectural Sheet Metal Manual standards. 
0102: 
Subcontractor agrees to ensure compatibility with all surrounding materials for each product used.  Material product data sheets must be delivered to project superintendent prior the each materials use on project.  
0103: 
Galvanized steel to be commercial quality carbon complying with ASTM A 755/A 755M. The Zinc coated process shall be per ASTM 653A/653M.
0104: 
Provide 24 gage minimum unless a heavier gage is noted on plans or code requirements for the use specified.
0105: 
If materials are shown as pre finished in color, all finishes shall be factory baked enamel unless noted otherwise on plans. All finish colors will be selected by owner/ architect. 
0106: 
Copings and Parapet caps shall be installed using no exposed fasteners.  Use clip and cleat method of fasteners.   Ensure that no water will pond on surface and there is a positive drainage to roof areas, so that no drip marks will stain the stucco or wall faces. 
0107: 
Subcontractor agrees to conceal all fasteners where possible, use same metal as flashing/sheet metal or other corrosion resistant metal as recommended by manufacturer, match finish of exposed heads with material being fastened.
0200: 
Safety
0201: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Trench forms and Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the depth of the Subcontractor's work is greater than allowed. 
0202: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor's work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work 
0203: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor's work requires Safety Protection.
0204: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor's scope of work. 
0205: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor's weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0206: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor's representative or CALOSHA. 
0207: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0208: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor's work (if required) 
0300:

0303:

________________________________





Company Name:Mark Company


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Mark Company

Trade:A/C Paving

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Overtime pay must be approved in writing by the Construction Manager prior to work being performed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install labor, materials, tools, equipment and facilities to furnish and install all 3.5" AC Paving over 8" aggregate base any other items necessary  to complete the scope of work.  Subcontractor to return to furnish and install a 2" AC cap.  3 Move ins are included for 3.5" AC over Base and 1 move in for AC Cap.  Bid is based on soils report dated 7/25/06 and supplemented pavement section recommendations by Southwest Inspections $ Testing dated 7/16/11.
003: 
Subcontractor understands that curb & gutter and CTB at paver locations will be installed by others.  Subcontracotr will install up to curb & gutter and pave thorugh CTB at paver sections with 3 1/2" AC, No cap.
004: 
Subcontractor shall receive all grades at plus or minus .10' from Contractor. Subcontractor to cooridinate with the Grading Subcontractor.  Excludes any import or export of soil.  Alternate pricing provided to regrade from .5'.
005: 
Paving areas must have adequate slope as to appease all drainage and the City of San Diego requirements per plans and specifications.
006: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all clean up and removal of debris after completion of his work.
007: 
Subcontractor shall provide flagmen for any trucking operations as required.  Traffic controls systems or permits are by others.
008: 
Subcontractor shall repair or replace and erosion control materials damaged by their work.  Set up of erosion control items are by others.
009: 
Pricing is a lump sum, fixed price per plans and specifications.  Prices are good through 12/31/2011.  If work is not schedule prior to this date, 30 days advance notice shall be provided by the Subcontractor if there are any changes .  If notice is not provided the contract price will not be increased.  
010: 
Subcontractor has provided for 2" AC cap including light wash and tack coat at AC areas.
011: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
012: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent.

Alternates

001: 
Balance Streets Within Curb Lines +/-.5 to +/-.1' @ LS $12,370.00

002: 
6" Scarify, Moisture condition, Recompact and Fine Grade @ LS $16,788.00

Exclusions

001: 
Signage and striping.
002: 
Adjsutments to manholes and valve covers.
003: 
Engineering, surveying, plan preparation, soils testing, deputy inspections and material testing.
004: 
Water.
005: 
Base under curb and gutter.

________________________________





Company Name:National Demolition


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:National Demolition

Trade:Abatement & Demolition

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m (if required by General Contractor  required to maintain construction schedule).  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide notification to the SCAQMD and all other agencies having jurisdiction of the abatement of the structures.  Subcontractor shall procure and pay for all permits for this work.
003: 
Subcontractor shall handle, transport and dispose of all hazardous materils in accordance with federal, state and local regulations to an EPA approved landfill.
004: 
Subcontractor shall remove and legally dispose of all asbestos and lead containing materials in accordance with Anderson Enviromental survey report dated 6/2/2010.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and material to provide containment of asbestos and lead to the work areas and provide air samples in accordance with all state and local agencies having jurisdiction.
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install sidewalk pedestrian protection canopy during the course of the demolition work.  
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools and equipment to perform the demolition of the existing structures and haul off all debris to an approved landfill in accordance with plans by Studio One Eleven dated 9/28/2010 and jobsite visit of the project site to include but not limited to the following;  building structures and foundations complete,  asphalt, concrete, drain grates, iron fences and gates, planter walls and footings, guard posts, trash enclouser, trees and shrubs, misc vegetation, and all other misc items to provide a commplete demolition.
008: 
Upon completion the project site shall be left in a clean and level condition.
009: 
Subcontractor shall cap all existing sewer laterals in accordance with state and local codes, city of Long Beach and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall saw cut all concrete and asphalt as required to provide a acceptable trasition to the new construction.
011: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
012: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
013: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
014: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
015: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide closeout documentation to General Contractor at completion of all abatement and demolition work.

Alternates


Exclusions



Schedule of Values

001 : Submittals Approved : 1000.0000 : 02050000
002 : AQMD Notification & Permits Procured : 1000.0000 : 02050000
003 : Abatement Completed : 18580.0000 : 02050000
004 : Demolition Completed : 41400.0000 : 02050000
005 : Closeout documents : 1000.0000 : 02050000

Original Contract Amount: 62980.0000


Revised Contract Amount: 62980.0000

Company Name:Custom Components Co., LLC dba US Railing


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Custom Components Co., LLC dba US Railing

Trade:Aluminum Canopies

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Subcontract has agreed to suppllement labor to ensure schedlule in liue of Saturday work.   No overtime or premium time shall be allowed or paid to acheive the schedule.
002: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Aluminum Canopies including wall connections per plan elevations A2.11-A2.14, details AD51 and specifications at Buildings B and C.  Subcontractor shall provide engineered drawings for attachment to the structure for review.
003: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all bolts as required per plans, specifications and approved shop drawings for erection of all work covered by this scope after plaster installation.
004: 
Subcontractor shall indicate on all shop and erection drawings profiles, sizes, spacing, locations, attachments and fasteners.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install powder coated aluminum in color to be determinned by the Architect.
006: 
Subcontactor shall furnish and install all anchors required to attach the canopies per plans and specifications.
007: 
Subcontractor shall provide one mobilization for each building as required to achieve occupancy.
008: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all unloading and hoisting as required for installation.
009: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade.
010: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent.
011: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for the cost of replacement by others.  
012: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  

Alternates


Exclusions

001: 
Field Testing
002: 
Protective Film
003: 
Final Cleaning
004: 
Bond

Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools and equipment to perform the demolition of the existing structures and haul off all debris to an approved landfill in accordance with plans by Studio One Eleven dated 9/28/2010 and jobsite visit of the project site to include but not limited to the following;  building structures and foundations complete,  asphalt, concrete, drain grates, iron fences and gates, planter walls and footings, guard posts, trash enclouser, trees and shrubs, misc vegetation, and all other misc items to provide a commplete demolition.
008: 
Upon completion the project site shall be left in a clean and level condition.
009: 
Subcontractor shall cap all existing sewer laterals in accordance with state and local codes, city of Long Beach and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall saw cut all concrete and asphalt as required to provide a acceptable trasition to the new construction.
011: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
012: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
013: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
014: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
015: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide closeout documentation to General Contractor at completion of all abatement and demolition work.

Company Name:Secure Sheet Metal


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Secure Sheet Metal

Trade:Aluminum Siding & Sheet Metal

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific:
0001: 
Subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract unless specifically stated above. It is agreed and understood that this is a lump sum contract and that there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs and without a fully executed change order.
0002: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all Structural and Architectural drawings and is responsible for all Sheet Metal per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.
0003: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with all other trades to accomplish all preliminary operations including embed sheet metal (reglets, dado, etc) items for the masonry subcontractor or other trades as needed or indicated on plans. 
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all sheet metal trade work, including but not limited to the following:
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Roof Areas
Coping
Mechanical Platform Covers
Elevator Vents
Trash Chute Covers
Roof Threshold Flashings
Deck Fla+shing
Balcony Deck Flashing
Roof Scuppers
Roof Overflow Scuppers
Balcony Scuppers
Downspouts
Threshold Flashings at Doors
Threshold Flashings at Sliding Glass Doors
Podium Deck Flashing
Leader Heads
Deck Edge Flashing
Storefront Sill Flashing
Curtain Wall Head Flashing
Bath Vents
Boiler Covers
AC Covers
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Grade Levels
Fascia at Pitched Roofs
Fascia at Horizontal Projections
Break Metal at Windows
Fascia with Built In Gutter
Window Head Flashing
Garage Vent Louvers
Metal Siding "Opaline"
Cricket Flashing
Break Metal at Fire Sprinkler Head Enclosures
Fascia at Corridor and Deck Railings
Podium to Framing Flashing
0005: 
Subcontractor shall layout and mark all vent shafts and roof penetrations for the rough carpentry subcontractor. All dimensions are to be calculated as stud to stud. (Cutting of wood members by others).
0006: 
Subcontractor shall mark all vent shafts to receive drywall in bright marking paint prior to preliminary drywall work.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall insure that all roof penetrations and terminations are complete before any roofing begins. 
0008: 
Subcontractor shall install work with laps, joints and seams which will be permanently water tight and weatherproof.
0100: 
Materials:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all fasteners, solder, mastic sealants flashing compound, roofing cement, electrometric sealants as part of this contract.  All sealants, mastics and solders are to meet current SMACNA's Architectural Sheet Metal Manual standards. 
0102: 
Subcontractor agrees to ensure compatibility with all surrounding materials for each product used.  Material product data sheets must be delivered to project superintendent prior the each materials use on project.  
0103: 
Galvanized steel to be commercial quality carbon complying with ASTM A 755/A 755M. The Zinc coated process shall be per ASTM 653A/653M.
0104: 
Provide 24 gage minimum unless a heavier gage is noted on plans or code requirements for the use specified.
0105: 
If materials are shown as pre finished in color, all finishes shall be factory baked enamel unless noted otherwise on plans. All finish colors will be selected by owner/ architect. 
0106: 
Copings and Parapet caps shall be installed using no exposed fasteners.  Use clip and cleat method of fasteners.   Ensure that no water will pond on surface and there is a positive drainage to roof areas, so that no drip marks will stain the stucco or wall faces. 
0107: 
Subcontractor agrees to conceal all fasteners where possible, use same metal as flashing/sheet metal or other corrosion resistant metal as recommended by manufacturer, match finish of exposed heads with material being fastened.
0200: 
Safety
0201: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Trench forms and Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the depth of the Subcontractor's work is greater than allowed. 
0202: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor's work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work 
0203: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor's work requires Safety Protection.
0204: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor's scope of work. 
0205: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor's weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0206: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor's representative or CALOSHA. 
0207: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0208: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor's work (if required) 
0300: 
Pickup
0301: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
0302: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractor's Superintendent.
0303: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for that cost if replaced by others.   
0304: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0400: 
Cleanup
0401: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor's containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0402: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor's waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel and sweep clean these areas and paths nightly. 
0403: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove all trash generated by their finish installation crews on finish their operations.
0404: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0405: 
All miscellaneous debris will be taken to containers or piled in areas designated by the Contractor's Superintendent.

Company Name:General Electric


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:General Electric

Trade:Appliances

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
OPERATIONS
002: 
1.    Subcontractor shall include all taxes, delivery, spreading to individual units, and complete installation costs for all necessary appliances. 
003: 
2.    Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer’s paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
004: 
3.    Refrigerators shall include all parts and hook up to manufacturers plumbing, electrical and cabinetry specifications and water lines from house supply shall be cleared of all debris prior to connection to refrigerator. 
005: 
4.    Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately two (2) weeks. 
006: 
DELIVERY
007: 
5.    There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
008: 
6.    All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day.
009: 
7.    All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
010: 
8.    Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
011: 
INSTALLATION
012: 
9.    Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.
013: 
10.  Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.
014: 
11.  Subcontractor agrees to coordinate his work with associated trades and shall notify Contractor’s Superintendent or representative any corrections necessary in order to complete the work outlined in this contract.
015: 
12.  Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
016: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
017: 
13.  In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor’s Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
018: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS

PLAN CHANGES AND CLARIFICATIONS
024: 
14.  The specifications outlined in the “Project Specification Book” and or “Project Manual,” shall take precedence over specifications outlined in this scope of work unless otherwise stated below.  The Project Specification Book shall be considered a part of the Contract Agreement and it is Subcontractor’s responsibility to clarify discrepancies with Contractor’s Purchasing Department prior to award of contract.  Subcontractor is to review said document for other trades product specification which may affect his work.
025: 
a.    EXCLUDED – Coil operated washers and dryers by others.
026: 
PICK-UP
027:

028: 
16.  All damaged material will be replaced immediately.
029:

030:

________________________________





Company Name:Warehouse Discount Center


ProjectName: Alta Centrum Apartments  - San Diego ProjectID = 44

Subcontractor:Warehouse Discount Center

Trade:Appliances - Laundry

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer's paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
003: 
Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately three (3) weeks. 
004: 
DELIVERY & SPREADING
005: 
There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
006: 
All deliveries and storage of materials shall be approved and coordinated by the Project Superintendent.
007: 
Subcontractor shall deliver, spread, and uncrate all appliances.
008: 
All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day. All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
009: 
Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
010: 
In the process of distribution of materials, Subcontractor shall not store or stack his materials in any manner that may hinder or increase the work of any other subcontractor.
011: 
Subcontractor acknowledges that a manlift or elevator may not be accessible or operational at the time of delivery and appliances may have to be transported via the stairwell.  
012: 
INSTALLATION
013: 
Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.  All appliances shall be set AND leveled.
014: 
Refrigerator install shall include all parts and hook up to manufacturer's plumbing, electrical and cabinetry specifications.  Subcontractor shall clear all water lines from house supply of all debris prior to connection of appliance.
015: 
Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.  
016: 
Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
017: 
PROTECTION OF ADJACENT SURFACES
018: 
Subcontractor acknowledges that their scope of work follow most of the other finish trades. Subcontractor will use the utmost care in protecting all the surrounding elements, including but not limited to, drywall, painted finishes, cabinets, countertops, resilient and carpet flooring.
019: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
020: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
021: 
All appliances shall be Frigidaire.
022: 
All appliances shall be white
023: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS - ONE (1) EACH
024: 
Frigidaire Electric Washer:  FAFW3801LW
025: 
Frigidaire Gas Dryer: FAQG7001LW
026: 
Side Exhaust Kit:  5305514872
027: 
Stack Kit:  STACKIT4X
028: 
Only the twelve (12) B3 plans receive the units installed side by side. All other plans are to receive the units installed with the stack kit. 
029: 
WARRANTY
030: 
All warranties for labor and material complete shall be one (1) year from date of install.
031: 
CLEAN UP
032: 
Subcontractor will leave job site clean of debris created by his work and haul off his debris to approved recycling facility and supply Contractor recycling receipts for record.
033: 
EXCLUSIONS
034: 
The following item(s) are excluded from this Subcontract:
035: 
kitchen appliances supplied and installed by others.
036: 
Garbage disposal shall be supplied and installed by others.

Alternates


Exclusions

002 : Frigidaire Dryer FAQG7001LW : 212008.8100 : 11030100

Company Name:Mark Company

Trade:A/C Paving

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Overtime pay must be approved in writing by the Construction Manager prior to work being performed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install labor, materials, tools, equipment and facilities to furnish and install all 3.5" AC Paving over 8" aggregate base any other items necessary  to complete the scope of work.  Subcontractor to return to furnish and install a 2" AC cap.  3 Move ins are included for 3.5" AC over Base and 1 move in for AC Cap.  Bid is based on soils report dated 7/25/06 and supplemented pavement section recommendations by Southwest Inspections $ Testing dated 7/16/11.
003: 
Subcontractor understands that curb & gutter and CTB at paver locations will be installed by others.  Subcontracotr will install up to curb & gutter and pave thorugh CTB at paver sections with 3 1/2" AC, No cap.
004: 
Subcontractor shall receive all grades at plus or minus .10' from Contractor. Subcontractor to cooridinate with the Grading Subcontractor.  Excludes any import or export of soil.  Alternate pricing provided to regrade from .5'.
005: 
Paving areas must have adequate slope as to appease all drainage and the City of San Diego requirements per plans and specifications.
006: 
Subcontractor is responsible for all clean up and removal of debris after completion of his work.
007: 
Subcontractor shall provide flagmen for any trucking operations as required.  Traffic controls systems or permits are by others.
008: 
Subcontractor shall repair or replace and erosion control materials damaged by their work.  Set up of erosion control items are by others.
009: 
Pricing is a lump sum, fixed price per plans and specifications.  Prices are good through 12/31/2011.  If work is not schedule prior to this date, 30 days advance notice shall be provided by the Subcontractor if there are any changes .  If notice is not provided the contract price will not be increased.  
010: 
Subcontractor has provided for 2" AC cap including light wash and tack coat at AC areas.
011: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
012: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors 's Superintendent.

________________________________





Company Name:National Demolition


ProjectName: LB + Anaheim Senior Artists Colony ProjectID = 47

Subcontractor:National Demolition

Trade:Abatement & Demolition

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
Working hours to perform this Subcontract are as follows;  Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Saturday 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m (if required by General Contractor  required to maintain construction schedule).  No overtime or premium time shall be allowed.
002: 
Subcontractor shall provide notification to the SCAQMD and all other agencies having jurisdiction of the abatement of the structures.  Subcontractor shall procure and pay for all permits for this work.
003: 
Subcontractor shall handle, transport and dispose of all hazardous materils in accordance with federal, state and local regulations to an EPA approved landfill.
004: 
Subcontractor shall remove and legally dispose of all asbestos and lead containing materials in accordance with Anderson Enviromental survey report dated 6/2/2010.
005: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor and material to provide containment of asbestos and lead to the work areas and provide air samples in accordance with all state and local agencies having jurisdiction.
006: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install sidewalk pedestrian protection canopy during the course of the demolition work.  
007: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, materials, tools and equipment to perform the demolition of the existing structures and haul off all debris to an approved landfill in accordance with plans by Studio One Eleven dated 9/28/2010 and jobsite visit of the project site to include but not limited to the following;  building structures and foundations complete,  asphalt, concrete, drain grates, iron fences and gates, planter walls and footings, guard posts, trash enclouser, trees and shrubs, misc vegetation, and all other misc items to provide a commplete demolition.
008: 
Upon completion the project site shall be left in a clean and level condition.
009: 
Subcontractor shall cap all existing sewer laterals in accordance with state and local codes, city of Long Beach and all agencies having jurisdiction.
010: 
Subcontractor shall saw cut all concrete and asphalt as required to provide a acceptable trasition to the new construction.
011: 
Subcontractor shall dispose of waste materials in a legally ordained waste dumping facility certified for the type of material contained in his transports.  Any illegal dumping will be the sole responsibility of the Subcontractor.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for all fines levied against Subcontractor as a result of the improper or illegal disposal of any waste materials.
012: 
Subcontractor shall recycle all possible materials and provide Contractor with documentation, ie. receipts and/or tickets, City provided Construction and Demolition paperwork, for City mandated recycling program.  Subcontractor acknowledges that he is aware of said program and shall fully participate in its implementation.
013: 
Subcontractor shall not mix toxic or illegal compounds with normal construction waste.  Subcontractor shall adhere to all EPA, Federal, State and local regulations related to waste removal, recycling, and dumping.
014: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all permit, dump, recycling fees and charges associated with the removal and disposal of debris hauled from jobsite.
015: 
Subcontractor shall have at least one (1) English speaking employee on the jobsite at all times. 
016: 
Subcontractor shall provide closeout documentation to General Contractor at completion of all abatement and demolition work.

Alternates


Exclusions



Schedule of Values

001 : Submittals Approved : 1000.0000 : 02050000
002 : AQMD Notification & Permits Procured : 1000.0000 : 02050000
003 : Abatement Completed : 18580.0000 : 02050000
004 : Demolition Completed : 41400.0000 : 02050000
005 : Closeout documents : 1000.0000 : 02050000

Original Contract Amount: 62980.0000


Revised Contract Amount: 62980.0000

004:

005:

________________________________





Company Name:Secure Sheet Metal


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Secure Sheet Metal

Trade:Aluminum Siding & Sheet Metal

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific:
0001: 
Subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract unless specifically stated above. It is agreed and understood that this is a lump sum contract and that there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs and without a fully executed change order.
0002: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all Structural and Architectural drawings and is responsible for all Sheet Metal per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.
0003: 
Subcontractor shall coordinate with all other trades to accomplish all preliminary operations including embed sheet metal (reglets, dado, etc) items for the masonry subcontractor or other trades as needed or indicated on plans. 
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all sheet metal trade work, including but not limited to the following:
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Roof Areas
Coping
Mechanical Platform Covers
Elevator Vents
Trash Chute Covers
Roof Threshold Flashings
Deck Fla+shing
Balcony Deck Flashing
Roof Scuppers
Roof Overflow Scuppers
Balcony Scuppers
Downspouts
Threshold Flashings at Doors
Threshold Flashings at Sliding Glass Doors
Podium Deck Flashing
Leader Heads
Deck Edge Flashing
Storefront Sill Flashing
Curtain Wall Head Flashing
Bath Vents
Boiler Covers
AC Covers
2 Piece Reglet Flashing at Grade Levels
Fascia at Pitched Roofs
Fascia at Horizontal Projections
Break Metal at Windows
Fascia with Built In Gutter
Window Head Flashing
Garage Vent Louvers
Metal Siding "Opaline"
Cricket Flashing
Break Metal at Fire Sprinkler Head Enclosures
Fascia at Corridor and Deck Railings
Podium to Framing Flashing
0005: 
Subcontractor shall layout and mark all vent shafts and roof penetrations for the rough carpentry subcontractor. All dimensions are to be calculated as stud to stud. (Cutting of wood members by others).
0006: 
Subcontractor shall mark all vent shafts to receive drywall in bright marking paint prior to preliminary drywall work.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall insure that all roof penetrations and terminations are complete before any roofing begins. 
0008: 
Subcontractor shall install work with laps, joints and seams which will be permanently water tight and weatherproof.
0100: 
Materials:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all fasteners, solder, mastic sealants flashing compound, roofing cement, electrometric sealants as part of this contract.  All sealants, mastics and solders are to meet current SMACNA's Architectural Sheet Metal Manual standards. 
0102: 
Subcontractor agrees to ensure compatibility with all surrounding materials for each product used.  Material product data sheets must be delivered to project superintendent prior the each materials use on project.  
0103: 
Galvanized steel to be commercial quality carbon complying with ASTM A 755/A 755M. The Zinc coated process shall be per ASTM 653A/653M.
0104: 
Provide 24 gage minimum unless a heavier gage is noted on plans or code requirements for the use specified.
0105: 
If materials are shown as pre finished in color, all finishes shall be factory baked enamel unless noted otherwise on plans. All finish colors will be selected by owner/ architect. 
0106: 
Copings and Parapet caps shall be installed using no exposed fasteners.  Use clip and cleat method of fasteners.   Ensure that no water will pond on surface and there is a positive drainage to roof areas, so that no drip marks will stain the stucco or wall faces. 
0107: 
Subcontractor agrees to conceal all fasteners where possible, use same metal as flashing/sheet metal or other corrosion resistant metal as recommended by manufacturer, match finish of exposed heads with material being fastened.
0200: 
Safety
0201: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Trench forms and Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the depth of the Subcontractor's work is greater than allowed. 
0202: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor's work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work 
0203: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor's work requires Safety Protection.
0204: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor's scope of work. 
0205: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor's weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0206: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor's representative or CALOSHA. 
0207: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0208: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor's work (if required) 
0300: 
Pickup
0301: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade. 
0302: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractor's Superintendent.
0303: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for that cost if replaced by others.   
0304: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0400: 
Cleanup
0401: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor's containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0402: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor's waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel and sweep clean these areas and paths nightly. 
0403: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove all trash generated by their finish installation crews on finish their operations.
0404: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0405: 
All miscellaneous debris will be taken to containers or piled in areas designated by the Contractor's Superintendent.

Company Name:General Electric


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:General Electric

Trade:Appliances

Project Specific Scope of Work

001: 
OPERATIONS
002: 
1.    Subcontractor shall include all taxes, delivery, spreading to individual units, and complete installation costs for all necessary appliances. 
003: 
2.    Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer’s paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
004: 
3.    Refrigerators shall include all parts and hook up to manufacturers plumbing, electrical and cabinetry specifications and water lines from house supply shall be cleared of all debris prior to connection to refrigerator. 
005: 
4.    Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately two (2) weeks. 
006: 
DELIVERY
007: 
5.    There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
008: 
6.    All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day.
009: 
7.    All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
010: 
8.    Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
011: 
INSTALLATION
012: 
9.    Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.
013: 
10.  Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.
014: 
11.  Subcontractor agrees to coordinate his work with associated trades and shall notify Contractor’s Superintendent or representative any corrections necessary in order to complete the work outlined in this contract.
015: 
12.  Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
016: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
017: 
13.  In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor’s Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
018: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS
019: 
Electric range: Front controls & std clean: JBS13 x 46
020: 
Range hood: 30” hood, non-vented: JN327 x 46
021: 
Refrigerator: 18.0 cu ft, top-freezer, glass shelves, energy star: GTH18JB x 46
022: 
Dishwasher: 5 Cycle, 3 options, power scrub, energy star: GSD3300 x 46
023: 
PLAN CHANGES AND CLARIFICATIONS
024: 
14.  The specifications outlined in the “Project Specification Book” and or “Project Manual,” shall take precedence over specifications outlined in this scope of work unless otherwise stated below.  The Project Specification Book shall be considered a part of the Contract Agreement and it is Subcontractor’s responsibility to clarify discrepancies with Contractor’s Purchasing Department prior to award of contract.  Subcontractor is to review said document for other trades product specification which may affect his work.
025: 
a.    EXCLUDED – Coil operated washers and dryers by others.
026: 
PICK-UP
027: 
15.  Perform all corrective work necessary to provide a finished product that meets the Contractor’s standards.  Pick-up work will be completed with in seventy-two (72) hours of installation.
028: 
16.  All damaged material will be replaced immediately.
029: 
17.  Subcontractor shall have all pick-up work completed prior to Owner walk-thru.
030: 
WARRANTY INFORMATION
031: 
18.  All warranties for labor and materials, complete, shall be two (2) years from date of install.

001:

002: 
Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer's paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
003: 
Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately three (3) weeks. 
004: 
DELIVERY & SPREADING
005: 
There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
006: 
All deliveries and storage of materials shall be approved and coordinated by the Project Superintendent.
007: 
Subcontractor shall deliver, spread, and uncrate all appliances.
008: 
All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day. All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
009: 
Subcontractor is responsible for any damage or theft prior to installation.
010: 
In the process of distribution of materials, Subcontractor shall not store or stack his materials in any manner that may hinder or increase the work of any other subcontractor.
011: 
Subcontractor acknowledges that a manlift or elevator may not be accessible or operational at the time of delivery and appliances may have to be transported via the stairwell.  
012: 
INSTALLATION
013: 
Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.  All appliances shall be set AND leveled.
014: 
Refrigerator install shall include all parts and hook up to manufacturer's plumbing, electrical and cabinetry specifications.  Subcontractor shall clear all water lines from house supply of all debris prior to connection of appliance.
015: 
Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.  
016: 
Subcontractor shall deliver garbage disposal with pigtail electrical attached to Plumbing Subcontractor for his installation.
017: 
Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
018: 
PROTECTION OF ADJACENT SURFACES
019: 
Subcontractor acknowledges that their scope of work follow most of the other finish trades. Subcontractor will use the utmost care in protecting all the surrounding elements, including but not limited to, drywall, painted finishes, cabinets, countertops, resilient and carpet flooring.
020: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
021:

Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
022:

SPECIFIC - APPLIANCES
002:

003: 
Subcontractor agrees that manufacturer's paperwork shall be included with appliances. 
004:

005: 
Lead time for all appliances shall be approximately three (3) weeks. 
006: 
DELIVERY
007: 
There shall be no minimum delivery and deliveries shall be made to the project by this Subcontractor.
008: 
All materials delivered to job site shall be immediately stocked into dwelling units the same day and installation shall commence that day or no later than the following day.
009: 
All materials shall remain the property of this Subcontractor until installed and accepted by Contractor.
010: 
INSTALLATION
011: 
Subcontractor guarantees all work will be performed in a first class workmanship manner, by qualified workmen experienced in this trade.
012: 
Subcontractor agrees to include any pigtails required to complete installations at no extra cost.
013: 
Any defective or substandard material will not be installed by Subcontractor.  If any such defective or substandard materials are installed, Subcontractor shall remove and reinstall at no extra charge.  Any damage due to repairs or replacement of defective or substandard materials shall be at the sole expense of this Subcontractor.
014: 
PRODUCT AND MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS
015: 
In the event of manufacturing model changes and/or discontinuation of specified products covered by this agreement, Subcontractor shall notify Contractor's Purchasing Department of the changes in writing.  Model number cross-references shall be provided as part of the written notification.  Authorization to substitute products must be evidenced by a change order to this contract.
016: 
All appliances shall be General Electric appliances
017: 
RESIDENTIAL UNITS - ONE (1) EACH
018:

019:

Company Name:Robert Lunetta Co


ProjectName: Long Beach Burnett Apartments ProjectID = 37

Subcontractor:Robert Lunetta Co

Trade:Balcony Railings, Vehicle Gates, & Decorative Fencing

Project Specific Scope of Work

0000: 
Specific
0001: 
The subcontractor acknowledges and agrees that this is a turnkey contract, unless otherwise specifically stated above. It is also agreed and understood that this is a Not To Exceed Contract and there will be no additions or deletions unless a major change in scope occurs. In the event there is a major change in the subcontractor's scope of work a change order will be issued by Cobalt Construction.  
0002: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all labor, material, tools, equipment and supplies as necessary to complete the Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates work in accordance with plans, specifications, state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction. All Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates shall be constructed plumb and true, square and properly fitted in accordance with the drawings and shall consist of, but not be limited to, all necessary materials including screws, bolts, brackets, and all other miscellaneous items not specifically mentioned hereinafter.
0003: 
Subcontractor has reviewed all plans specified in the contract and is responsible for all Decorative Iron and Vehicle Gates per the plans and specifications unless noted otherwise in the contract documents.  Subcontractor shall be solely responsible for verifying with Contractor’s Superintendent that he has all the latest contract documents, plans and specifications prepared and approved for construction.
0004: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all work as indicated on the approved plans and any variations or discrepancies noted shall be immediately brought to the attention of Contractor's Representative and resolved. No deviations regarding the design or structural integrity of the building are acceptable. 
0005: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Balcony Rails, Parapet Guard Rails and Balcony Privacy Screens per plans and specifications. Balcony rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0006: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Podium Deck, Corridor, and Roof Guard Rails per plans and specifications. Guard Rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0007: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Entry Stoop Stair Rails and Guard Rails per plans and specifications. Entry Stoop Guard Rails shall include metal inset panels per plans and specifications.
0008: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Steel Roof Ladders and Elevator Pit Ladders per plans and specifications. 
0009: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Bollards per plans and specifications. 
0010: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Garage Fencing and Automatic Vehicle Gates per plans and specifications. Vehicle Gates shall include motors, installation of safety loops, and (50) remotes per plans and specifications.
0011: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install all Site Fencing and Pedestrian Gates per plans and specifications.
0012: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate, furnish, and install Patio Fencing and Gates per plans and specifications.
0013: 
Subcontractor agrees to supply shop drawings with submittals; Submit shop drawings for structural steel, steel and stairs and rails prior to fabrication and installation.
0014: 
Subcontractor shall furnish to job site superintendent all material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) literature for all materials prior to delivery of any materials.
0100: 
Shop Drawings:
0101: 
Subcontractor shall indicate all shop and erection details including cuts, penetrations for pipes and ducts, profiles, sizes, spacing, locations of structural members, openings, attachments, fasteners, and welds.
0102: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for Steel Stairs under direct supervision of and signed and sealed by a California-licensed Structural Engineer experienced in design of this work.
0103: 
Subcontractor shall prepare Shop Drawings for submittal to the Engineer of Record for approval per structural note 12/S1.0.
0104: 
Subcontractor shall identify all welded connections, both shop and field, with AWS A 2.4 welding symbols for welding and Non-Destructive Testing.
0105: 
Subcontractor shall sbmit manufacturer’s mill certificates and mill test report for all structural steel to be used in the work.
0106: 
Subcontractor shall certify all welders employed on the Work, verifying AWS qualification within the previous 12 months in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
0107: 
For metal stairs include pans, elevations, sections, details, and attachments to other work. Provide templates for anchors and bolts specified for installation under other Sections.
0200: 
Examination
0201: 
Subcontractor is responsible for field verifying all measurements prior to fabrication and Installation.
0202: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for the layout. Said layout shall conform to those physical dimensions as shown on the plan.
0300: 
Fabrication
0301: 
Subcontractor shall fit and shop-assemble items in largest practical sections, for delivery to site.
0302: 
Subcontractor shall fabricate items with joints tightly fitted and secured.
0303: 
Subcontractor shall grind exposed joints flush and smooth with adjacent finish surface. Ease exposed edges to small uniform radius.
0304: 
Exposed Mechanical Fastenings: Flush countersunk screws or bolts; unobtrusively located; consistent with design of component, except where specifically noted otherwise.
0305: 
Subcontractor shall supply components required for anchorage of fabrications. Fabricate anchors and related components of same material and finish as fabrication, except where specifically noted otherwise.
0400: 
Preparation
0401: 
Subcontractor shall clean and strip primed steel items to bare metal where site welding is required in accordance with all state and local codes and agencies having jurisdiction.
0500: 
Installation
0501: 
Subcontractor shall install items plumb and level, accurately fitted, free from distortion or defects.
0502: 
Subcontractor shall provide for erection loads, and for sufficient temporary bracing to maintain true alignment until completion of erection and installation of permanent attachments.
0503: 
Subcontractor shall field weld all components as indicated on Drawings.
0504: 
Subcontractor to perform field welding in accordance with AWS D1.1. Please send AWS D1.1 for review.
0505: 
Subcontractor to obtain approval prior to site cutting or making adjustments not scheduled or indicated on drawings.
0506: 
Subcontractor shall, after erection, prime welds, abrasions, and surfaces not shop primed, except surfaces to be in contact with concrete.
0507: 
Subcontractor shall ensure all welding procedures  are followed  for all material as required as a part of the contract.
0600: 
Finishes - steel
0601: 
Subcontractor shall clean surfaces of rust, scale, grease, and foreign matter prior to finishing.
0602: 
Subcontractor shall NOT prime surfaces in direct contact with concrete or where field welding is required.
0603: 
Subcontractor shall prime all ornamental iron with one coat Red oxide primer or equal (per specification manual) at exposed surfaces and two coats at all surfaces that will be inaccessible  after installation.
0700: 
Safety
0701: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Fall Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever the height of the Subcontractor’s work is greater than 7-feet from a lower level or surface. Subcontractor shall maintain fall protection during their scope of work
0702: 
Subcontractor shall furnish and install all related Safety Protection per CALOSHA requirements wherever Subcontractor’s work requires Safety Protection.
0703: 
Subcontractor shall replace and maintain all Safety Protection moved or altered by the Subcontractor during the Subcontractor’s scope of work.
0704: 
Subcontractor shall furnish a copy of the Subcontractor’s weekly tailgate safety meetings roll call sheets with each draw request
0705: 
Subcontractor shall maintain up to date copies of their IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program), MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets), and all  tailgate safety meetings on site and available for inspection by Contractor’s  representative or CALOSHA.
0706: 
Subcontractor shall furnish all traffic control, flagmen, barricade, flashers, etc. as required to complete this scope of work.
0707: 
Subcontractor shall only perform welding within easy reach of a fully charged fire extinguisher. One 10 pound capacity ABC rated fire extinguisher for each torch / welder at all times.
0708: 
Subcontractor shall furnish required CALOSHA permit prior to start of Subcontractor’s work (if required).
0800: 
Pickup
0801: 
Subcontractor shall be responsible for all pickup as related to this trade.
0802: 
Subcontractor shall respond within 48 hour notice to proceed with any pickup by Contractors  Superintendent.
0803: 
Should Subcontractor remove any other trades clips, braces, dotty plates, straps, lights or boxes during this operation, these items will be replaced correctly or Subcontractor will be responsible for the cost of replacement by others.  
0804: 
Subcontractor shall provide all labor and equipment to remove and replace any unacceptable materials at no cost to Contractor.  
0900: 
Cleanup
0901: 
Subcontractor shall provide cleanup to Contractor’s containers or designated areas for collection and haul away by others.
0902: 
Subcontractor shall pile Subcontractor’s waste and debris away from corridors, halls or paths of travel. 
0903: 
Subcontractor shall sweep clean corridors, halls and paths of travel of any debris generated by their operations on a nightly basis.
0904: 
Subcontractor shall box up and remove to Contractor's containers all trash generated by their finish installation crews on completion of their operations.
0905: 
Subcontractor shall remove all unused and/or salvageable materials when substantially complete.
0906: 
Subcontractor shall remove all tools, miscellaneous hardware and materials left over at the end of the their work.
